commit_message:
Compress response's content according to client's accepted encoding

Currently Glance ignores the Accept-Encoding header and returns
responses as they are regardless the client accepts gzip or other type
of compression.

This patch adds this capability to glance (by using a middleware)
supporting just gzip for now.

Important note:
    - The patch uses a lazy compression for Content-Type
      application/octet-stream but in order to do that, the
      content-length has to be unset which means that when an image is
      downloaded the content-length will be unknown to the client.

Fixes bug: 1150380

Change-Id: I42af1fbd9e601e0340da31604a2f698d98ba3198

subject: Add crossdomain.xml middleware
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 860, 'name': 'Donagh McCabe', 'email': 'donagh.mccabe@hpe.com', 'username': 'donagh-mccabe'}, {'_account_id': 866, 'name': 'Chmouel Boudjnah', 'email': 'chmouel@chmouel.com', 'username': 'chmouel'}, {'_account_id': 904, 'name': 'Adrian Smith', 'email': 'adrian@17od.com', 'username': 'adriansmith'}, {'_account_id': 2166, 'name': 'SmokeStack CI', 'username': 'smokestack', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 2622, 'name': 'Samuel Merritt', 'email': 'sam@swiftstack.com', 'username': 'torgomatic'}, {'_account_id': 2649, 'name': 'Zhang Hua', 'email': 'zhuadl@cn.ibm.com', 'username': 'zhang-hare'}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 904, 'date': '2013-03-25 19:13:31.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Hi Donagh. crossdomain.xml has a lot of similarities to CORs. When I originally submitted CORS middleware it was (rightly) pointed out that it should be configurable on/off per tenant. I'd suggest a similar approach for crossdomain.xml."}, {'account_id': 2622, 'date': '2013-03-25 19:13:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

The middleware right now will respond with that XML document for *any* request to /crossdomain.xml, regardless of HTTP verb. Could you make it only do that for GET requests, please?

In particular, I'm concerned that a request like "HEAD /crossdomain.xml" will receive a response with a nonempty body, and RFC2616 doesn't allow HEAD responses to have bodies.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-03-25 19:34:08.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Doesn't seem to work

Build failed.  For information on how to proceed, see https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GerritJenkinsGithub#Test_Failures

"}, {'account_id': 860, 'date': '2013-03-25 19:38:04.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Re: CORS: I believe the difference between crossdomain.xml and CORS is that in CORS, the preflight request is directed at a *resource* (i.e, https://endpoint//v1/<account>/<container>[<object>]) whereas crossdomain.xml is blunt -- it's directed at the endpoint.

However, I'm open to correction.

Re: GET/HEAD. Good point. Will refactor."}, {'account_id': 860, 'date': '2013-03-26 09:29:07.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 2649, 'date': '2013-03-26 09:55:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: (1 inline comment)

Alright, code looks reasonable to me.

I don't know if it's required to answer HEAD or OPTIONS requests for /crossdomain.xml, but if it is, you'll need to add that support in. (I seriously have no idea. Please tell me if you think it's necessary or not. I have no idea what Flash or Silverlight do with this thing.)

However, this does need some documentation. Could you update etc/proxy-server.conf.sample and doc/source/misc.rst with entries for this new middleware?

Thanks."}, {'account_id': 860, 'date': '2013-03-26 18:28:34.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Wrt documentation, different middleware seem to do it differently. However, I agree I picked the least-effort route. I'll do a proper job.

Wrt CORS, OPTIONS, my knowledge is a bit sparse. I'm not actually the original author. We have it in production and I'm submitting it largely to make our life easier but also in the hope someone finds it useful. I'll dig a little deeper and include justification and usage in the documentation.

However, my mental model is that rossdomain.xml  is an early solution designed specifically for Flash to handle the cross-domain problem. Others picked it up and used the same mechanism. CORS came later, and is specific to HTML5. We can't simply rely on CORS since there are lots of legacy browsers out there."}, {'account_id': 2649, 'date': '2013-03-27 10:06:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

commit_message:
Add crossdomain.xml middleware

Allows client-side technologies such as Flash, Java and Silverlight running
on web pages served elsewhere to interact with the Swift API.

Bug #1159960

Change-Id: I7d0533a0aaf189ac452abbd983469acb064fdca4

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-04-12 11:59:19.000000000', 'message': 'Add instance_type extra_specs to system_metadata

With extra_specs in system_metadata, cases where db calls are needed
to fetch the extra_specs can be replaced with calls to
instance_types.extract_instance_type to get it from locally from the
instance.

Resolves bug 1134650.

Change-Id: I5b8edef84dc2b652778e364fbf886adcca0506f0
'}]
commit_message:
Add instance_type extra_specs to system_metadata

With extra_specs in system_metadata, cases where db calls are needed
to fetch the extra_specs can be replaced with calls to
instance_types.extract_instance_type to get it from locally from the
instance.

Resolves bug 1134650.

Change-Id: I5b8edef84dc2b652778e364fbf886adcca0506f0

commit_message:
Pin SQLAlchemy to 0.7.x

0.7.10 has been released and is compatible with 0.7.x. Instead
of pinning to 0.7.9, simply pin to 0.7.x to avoid SQLAlchemy 0.8

Also sync the 0.7.x requirements to 0.7 (to be in sync with other
OpenStack core components)

Fixes: Bug #1153983

Change-Id: Ie20344e96f3d12e93695579adff0a0d9b4c1c516

commit_message:
Remove internal store references from migration 015

Migration 015 was accessing a object internal to the swift store driver
and changing its behavior in order to do the migration.  This worked but
it made the assumption that the driver logic would not change without
also changing the migration code.  These two should not be dependent
upon each other.  This patch removes all dependencies on swift from the
migration code.

Fixes bug: 1025746
Change-Id: Ic9559ae809b8784d0992cb5275d3911a725110c8

commit_message:
Fallback to conductor if types are not stashed.

If the instance types are not stashed, fallback to
the conductor API to retrieve them.

bug 1164110

Change-Id: I1f0ef48e072f8580980de5bd8d43cf2206cd7d27
(cherry picked from commit e9c88b7d3657d83ab84c081fbd56183061ed09c7)

Fixes argument order of quantumv2.api.get_instance_nw_info

Fixes bug #1159042

Change-Id: I04136707cdf2ca716dabd92aa7a471c291a3b4eb
(cherry picked from commit be5ff02f7484a3594f3adeac56ed7aa1ddb475d3)

commit_message:
set bdm['volume_id'] to None rather than delete it

bdm is a sqlalchemy model object, it doesn't make sense to delete
an attribute, so just set it to None

Fix bug 1166160

Change-Id: I41017af602f0c8369d442b4a6936e1a829d2f9a9

This looks good to me but I am not approving because I want a third set of eyes on this... There must have been a reason this was the way it was?'}, {'account_id': 55, 'date': '2013-03-27 10:03:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

I agree wit you. I added a comment and the bug tracker, perhaps we can use it to discuss.
The first implementation was done by Eldar Nugaev:
https://github.com/openstack/nova/commit/fdab470f28a2cb8ef0c4d174241e5a6dc362a21d
Perhaps we can ask him.'}, {'account_id': 191, 'date': '2013-04-01 23:49:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

It's been quite some time, but if I remember correctly the idea behind the auto assigned floating IPs was that they didn't belong to your project and did not count against your quota, but were managed automatically as part of the instance create and destroy. They were also supposed to be immutable, so the api calls to deallocate or disassociate were supposed to fail. Vish may be able to shed some light here. It was, if I remember correctly, his use case."}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2013-04-02 14:40:03.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

This wasn't my use case, but I also recall that the original intention was that they were automatic and not managed by the user at all. Personally I think giving the user a bit more control probably won't hurt, but I suspect we should probably protect it with a config option (as much as I hate to add new options). The quota stuff especially, there may be deployers out there that specifically are using them without setting quotas."}, {'account_id': 191, 'date': '2013-04-03 18:15:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Do not merge

Agree with vish. This patch shouldn't be merged in it's current form. A config option such as "auto_assign_floating_ips" would work well. The idea being that if it is True, floating ips would work the way they do upstream today. If False, floating ips would work the way this patch handles it.

I'll keep an eye on it, but I want a -2 on here until the change so we don't end up with a merge since there are already +2s on it.'}, {'account_id': 55, 'date': '2013-04-03 18:23:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

Do you mean to add another boolean flag like 'mangeable_auto_assign_floating_ips' ?

When 'auto_assign_floating_ips' and 'mangeable_auto_assign_floating_ips' are True, the auto-assigned floating IPs would work the way this patch handles it.

And if 'auto_assign_floating_ips' is True and 'mangeable_auto_assign_floating_ips' are False, the auto-assigned floating IPs would work the way they do upstream today"}, {'account_id': 191, 'date': '2013-04-05 22:38:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

Edouard, yes that's what I'm suggesting"}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-04-13 06:03:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Abandoned

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-04-13 06:03:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 1501, 'date': '2013-04-26 23:09:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

We do have a use case where we need users to not be able to unassign auto assigned addresses, so we do need the additional 
mangeable_auto_assign_floating_ips flag.

(Default value of false of course)'}]

commit_message:
Treating auto-assigned floating IPs like normal floating IPs

User could unassigned an auto-assigned floating IPs of a server.
- When an auto-assigned floating IP is unassigned from a server, the
floating IP is automaticaly deallocated on the project.
- When a server is destroyed, the auto-assigned floating IP is
  deallocated on the project.
- Now, the auto-assigned floating IPs affect quota.

Change-Id: I9e80c2ef677192dfe9e415cbf4fd2192618207ba
Fixes: bug #1150772

commit_message:
Send a instance create error notification

Send a 'create.error' notification if instance creation (run_instance)
fails.

This will make it easier for external notification consuming systems to
learn when instance build attempts fail within the nova-compute layer.

blueprint create-error-notification

Change-Id: I62d7c9c80c51241bf124509af7cdd8484d9ea2d3

bit clearer.  A new BuildAbortException is used to short-circuit build
attempts consistently.

"}, {'created': '2013-04-24 18:19:59.000000000', 'message': "Send a 'create.error' notif if run_instance fails

Also refactor _run_instance() some to make the flow of notifications a
bit clearer.  New exceptions, BuildAbortException and
RescheduleException, are used to short-circuit build attempts consistently.

Change-Id: I3f01753bde8af0750ba9067c8a98ded45d5a0eb7
"}, {'created': '2013-04-26 15:24:34.000000000', 'message': 'Refactor _run_instance() to unify control flow

_run_instance() had multiple points where various classes of errors
were handled.  This patch classifies the possible error/exit conditions
into the following categories:

* success
* rescheduled - an error occurred, but the build will be returned to
scheduled for another attempt.
* aborted - build was aborted for a non-error.  (e.x. instace was
deleted during spawn)
* fatal - general case of uncaught exceptions resulting in the instance
going to error.

blueprint create-error-notification

Change-Id: I3f01753bde8af0750ba9067c8a98ded45d5a0eb7
'}]
commit_message:
Refactor _run_instance() to unify control flow

_run_instance() had multiple points where various classes of errors
were handled.  This patch classifies the possible error/exit conditions
into the following categories:

* success
* rescheduled - an error occurred, but the build will be returned to
scheduled for another attempt.
* aborted - build was aborted for a non-error.  (e.x. instace was
deleted during spawn)
* fatal - general case of uncaught exceptions resulting in the instance
going to error.

blueprint create-error-notification

Change-Id: I3f01753bde8af0750ba9067c8a98ded45d5a0eb7

'}, {'account_id': 1179, 'date': '2013-03-26 09:59:23.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

x-delete-at on the *incoming* COPY/X-Copy-From request should override x-delete-at in the response from the source object - just like metadata.

Really if you just add the x-delete-at copy in `copy_headers_into` the controller will already do the right thing.

I'm not sure if it adds much to perform a second copy of the orignal object before asserting on the headers - I think it'd be fine to check for x-delete-at on the same requests as the x-object-meta asserts in test_copy_from and test_COPY.

OTOH, if you wanted to make second requests to verify incoming headers will take precedence and over-write copied headers (e.g. x-delete-at and x-object-meta-test) - well that'd be quite nice acctually...

In case anyone else was wondering, x-delete-after gets translated at the top of PUT, so as long we do the right thing with x-delete-at on incoming requests, we get delete-after for free.

Nice change."}, {'account_id': 6835, 'date': '2013-03-31 06:28:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Thanks your advice.
I'll implement it later"}, {'account_id': 6835, 'date': '2013-04-03 17:57:17.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-04-03 18:37:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Works for me

'}, {'account_id': 1179, 'date': '2013-04-04 05:51:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Do not merge

Well phooy, it doesn't work. :'(

The x-delete-at will get copied onto the new object, but the blasted x-delete-at-(part|host|device) headers only get added up above the whole "if source_header" section kicks in.  Gagh.

So what this means is the object will stop being served after x-delete-at passes, but no record gets inserted into the .expiring_objects account so it won't ever get reaped - and stop taking up disk space - or cleared from the container listing - or stop counting towards X-Account-Bytes-Used.

I guess you can probably leave the x-delete-at|after validation where it is, but utility function the ring call and x-delete-at-part|host|device headers business, then just call it down further in the PUT closer to where it opens the greenpile for the connections?  Or something...

Sorry bro, i was diggin' how small this patch had gotten - looks like you're in for a bit more.  Hope you stick with it.  Catch me in #openstack-swift on Freenode if you wanna discuss.'}, {'account_id': 6835, 'date': '2013-04-04 20:15:11.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Hi clay,

Please check my understanding of what I should do.

x-delete-at is related with expiring support, which is not a simple header in response or request. What should I do is to take care of something like x-delete-at-(part|host|device), like https://github.com/openstack/swift/blob/master/swift/proxy/controllers/obj.py#L597. 

At the time of copying 'x-delete-at' header, I should ensure the new object with 'x-delete-at' will work well with current expiring support.

(I'm sorry to contact you so late, and I'll take this patch seriously)"}, {'account_id': 2622, 'date': '2013-04-04 22:13:10.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Currently, the way expiring objects work is that, when an object PUT or POST happens, the proxy looks for an X-Delete-At/After header, and if present, the proxy updates a specially-designated expiring objects container. (There's a few of these, each for a particular time window, yada yada yada.) Then, the object expirer daemon comes along periodically and actually does the deletion.

So, you've got a couple of options here. 

Option A: make it so that a copy request notices an X-Delete-At on the newly-created copy and updates the relevant expiring objects container. That's annoying because it's Yet Another Place(tm) where we have to remember to call this thing, and copy some logic over. I don't know; maybe with some good refactoring it'd be okay.

Option B: obviate the updating of the expiring objects container by making something else (the auditor, maybe?) look for an X-Delete-At on objects and handle the deletion. That's nice because now X-Delete-At is authoritative, not X-Delete-At plus an entry in some container db somewhere. It sucks because audits are really slow, so you won't get your space back for a while.

Option C: do something better than either one of those, because they're both ugly in their own special ways.

So, assuming I haven't gotten anything too egregiously wrong*, there's some stuff for you to think about.

* never assume that"}, {'account_id': 1179, 'date': '2013-04-04 22:36:46.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Yeah you've got the right bit!  I guess just do that closer to the _backend_requests call that actually uses those delete_at_part|nodes vars and you should be golden.

Testing expiring objects is sort of a trip.

a) saio docs don't generally have you copy out the etc/object-expirer.conf-sample
b) there is not .expiring_objects account until you run the container-updaters
c) You sorta need a second proxy instance with noauth so you can inspect the .expiring_objects account

Also, I think your commit message might be better worded:
'copy x-delete-at unless x-fresh-meta: true' since false is the default for COPY and PUT with X-Copy-From?"}, {'account_id': 6835, 'date': '2013-04-05 17:00:02.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 6835, 'date': '2013-04-05 17:25:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

I built testing environment.

Keep object-expirer and container-updater run forever.

With my last patch, Copying an object with 'x-delete-at' could n't work fine with expirer. Now it works well. (The key reason is x-delete-at-part|host|device in headers of request to object server)

I still have two questions.

1. How should I check such "x-delete-at-part|host|device" in UT? (like fake_request in test_POST_delete_at?)

2. I didn't totally understand sam's options....maybe I'm not so familiar with all functionality.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-04-05 18:04:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Works for me

Couple of inline, I'd think it would look best if the validation continued to happen at the top, and only add the backend expirer headers in *one place* in the method - probably right after the if source_header block before it sets up the pile for the backend requests - unless you can think of something cleaner; you'll just have to say 'if x-delete-at in headers' one more time.

I'm glad your offering a unittest, I think it needs it.  In tests/unit/proxy/test_server there's test_POST_delete_at, which creates an instance of the ObjectController and monkey patches it's make_request so it can capture the headers send to the backed servers (and assert they include the expirer container).

I'd probably try to copy that to write test_COPY_delete_at.

GL!"}, {'account_id': 6835, 'date': '2013-04-09 03:09:10.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-04-09 03:50:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Works for me

This works.  I think the current behavior is a bug (not a doc issue).  This is better and more consistant.

If you don't want to copy metadata you can set x-fresh-metadata in the copy request.  If you want everything BUT x-delete-at you can either over-ride in request (same as any other copied header) - or unset it after the copy.

One tactical thing - I'm a little less than satisfied with the 'x-delete-at in the past' check coming later in the request processing, but when I simulated a race by disabling the "is_expired" check in DiskFile on the object server to trigger the invalidation of a COPY request - the 400 came through cleanly to the client.  Only side effect seemed to be the object server throwing some eventlet debug garbage about having it's connection being closed.  But we get that all the time during client disconnect, so I think it's ok.

I'd like this to merge.'}, {'account_id': 2622, 'date': '2013-04-25 00:19:04.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Alright, I tried this out and it works. commit_message:
copy X-Delete-At unless X-Fresh-Metadata: true is supplied on an object copy

Current codes will copy metadata headers when x-fresh-metadata:false, we
still need copy "x-delete-at" header and ensure expiring work at the same
time.

Change-Id: Ie31326b5f7b565e51e5aa249279bc1786f7bc847
Fixes: bug #1067528

commit_message:
Update requests version

A python-requests upgrade process was started before grizzly and was
planned to get into havana. Current projects don't depend on
requests<=1.1 anymore and this upgrade is needed in python-glanceclient.

Clients using python-requests are listed bellow:

Cinder:
https://github.com/openstack/python-cinderclient/blob/master/tools/pip-requires#L3
Nova:
https://github.com/openstack/python-novaclient/blob/master/tools/pip-requires#L4
Keystone:
https://github.com/openstack/python-keystoneclient/blob/master/tools/pip-requires#L4

Change-Id: I56c42eb7fdc5ac19736f125d3bffc52c9e26efee

subject: Added command to generate keystone ssl keys
messages:
[{'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-04-16 05:00:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Works for me

Build succeeded.

- http://docs-draft.openstack.org/gate-openstack-cli-guide/check/1022/cli/quick-start : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/26987/1/check/gate-openstack-operations-guide/335 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/26987/1/check/gate-openstack-manuals-validate/571 : FAILURE (non-voting)
'}, {'account_id': 91, 'date': '2013-04-16 08:48:34.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Although the change makes sense, I'd make the change more complete. I would specify that: 1) in a production environment the certs/keys won't be generated by the keystone service, but probably by some external CA. In this case I would indicate where the certs and keys should be placed and 2) in a test environment we have to generate the keys (the change that you submitted)."}, {'account_id': 6843, 'date': '2013-04-17 03:01:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

This is for the basic install manual using CA certs are inappropriate here.'}, {'account_id': 91, 'date': '2013-04-17 12:13:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Why is it not appropriated in the basic guide? According to its description: "Contains a basic installation set up with production considerations for all OpenStack components with a controller node and compute node".'}, {'account_id': 6843, 'date': '2013-04-17 14:53:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Yes, it says that on the web site and I would submit that it is incorrect and should be updated since the first paragraph of the book reads "This document helps anyone who wants to deploy OpenStack Grizzly for development purposes". This guide is designed to help one get started on Openstack. A comment about CA certs might be included in the install and deploy guide, not here.'}, {'account_id': 91, 'date': '2013-04-18 08:10:20.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

[{'created': '2013-04-23 12:57:51.000000000', 'message': 'scrubber: dont print URI of image to be deleted

Print the ID not the URI of the image to to be scrubbed
as the URI can contain credentials

fixes bug lp# 1171851

'}]
commit_message:
scrubber: dont print URI of image to be deleted

Print the ID not the URI of the image to to be scrubbed
as the URI can contain credentials

fixes bug lp# 1171851

Change-Id: Ice2d3d25a23bae31380759b87b50228ba358dcf1

commit_message:
Fix fixed_ip_count_by_project in DB API

Fix "by project" filtering in fixed_ip_count_by_project
method of SQLAlchemy DB API implementation.

Fixes: bug #1171161
Change-Id: Id408aba6db4dd953945feba36d17b056266ca4b7

commit_message:
Bugfix: Deleting a claimed msg is idempotent.

If the message does not exist or expired, it's not an error to
delete nothing.  The original implementation works when claim
is not supplied, but throws exception when claim involves.

Change-Id: Ic689058c2f67be6c9eebd3ba342bb73369e4f41b

Also, I moved this stuff to a separate book, per that other bug I sent you. I don't know if you have to review/approve this one first before you can review/approve the other one? I should've checked that new book change in under this change (I think)."}, {'account_id': 964, 'date': '2013-04-26 18:10:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

This might sound really "out there" but I have some rough notes from meeting with Jorge about how to validate the XSDs with a tool he has. So moving the wadl to the xsd directory might break this validation? Not sure. It probably doesn't matter since we don't validate the xsds right now. Anyway here are the rough steps:

xercesj - https://github.com/RackerWilliams/xercesj

prereq: Need to add JAVA_HOME to environment

git clone https://github.com/RackerWilliams/xercesj, then
./build.sh mvninstall
then
cd into the api_samples directory
validate -xsd11 -fx -a <http to raw file or path/filename for schema
api.xsd> -i *.xml

api.xsd for servers/images/

api-common.xsd for rate-limiting, versions'}, {'account_id': 2448, 'date': '2013-04-26 18:25:24.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Anne, I'll just move the wadl files to a wadl directory - then if we ever *do* validated xsd's, it won't affect that."}, {'account_id': 2448, 'date': '2013-04-26 18:47:01.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-04-26 18:47:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Works for me

Change-Id: Ic73e76155b993bc6bcb21be12957688e74b95247
'}, {'created': '2013-04-26 14:36:28.000000000', 'message': 'Bug # 1172337 - Removed unnecessary redirection from includes.

In several instances the openstack-install guide includes content from
itself by first traversing up a directory (href="../openstack-install/...").

This causes some (minor) consternation when building with alternate
toolchains, I have moved content included in this manner (and associated
figures/samples) to the common content directory.

Change-Id: Ic73e76155b993bc6bcb21be12957688e74b95247
'}]
commit_message:
Bug # 1172337 - Removed unnecessary redirection from includes.

In several instances the openstack-install guide includes content from
itself by first traversing up a directory (href="../openstack-install/...").

This causes some (minor) consternation when building with alternate
toolchains, I have moved content included in this manner (and associated
figures/samples) to the common content directory.

Change-Id: Ic73e76155b993bc6bcb21be12957688e74b95247

commit_message:
cinder volume service keeps retrying even code exception

Make sure that ProcessLauncher does not try to restart the failed
service. And make sure the ProcessLauncher exits, when the number
of the failed services equal the number of total services.

Fixes: bug 1167841
Change-Id: I818c754534c18a62d292e21f0c98086571fe0565

commit_message:
Cinder wasn't filtering the backups returned to backup list API

This has the side effect of return all backups in the system (regardless of
who created them) to the user. You should only see the backups created in your
current active project.

Fixes bug: 1169461

Change-Id: I121e8ed215b28f1b21e24b2104f8294039e09b48

[{'created': '2013-04-25 16:15:56.000000000', 'message': 'Remove _path_exists method.

This method is buggy because it works only on host machine with english language, and
apparently this method is also useless because we don't need to check if a path exist if
we can use command option -p for "mkdir" command and option -f for "rm" command.

bug: LP#1172777
Change-Id: I418b32772ca97b42e1a43275a7abec9f96688607
'}]
commit_message:
Remove _path_exists method.

This method is buggy because it works only on host machine with english language, and
apparently this method is also useless because we don't need to check if a path exist if
we can use command option -p for "mkdir" command and option -f for "rm" command.

bug: LP#1172777
Change-Id: I418b32772ca97b42e1a43275a7abec9f96688607

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-04-15 15:27:05.000000000', 'message': 'Removes "RPC not enabled" error message when RPC backend is not needed

A RPC backend is needed only when at least one of the following services is
enabled: nova quantum heat glance cinder ceilometer. When none of these
services is activated, no error message should appear if a RPC backend is not
set via ENABLED_SERVICES.

Change-Id: I4e47e0c675c74775b4ea53a00848ac1d777f0125
Fixes: bug #1167338
'}, {'created': '2013-04-24 08:32:40.000000000', 'message': 'Removes "RPC not enabled" error message when RPC backend is not needed

When no service needing a RPC backend is activated, no error message should
appear if a RPC backend is not installed. A simple check is done on the
services installation files to see which services need to initialize a RPC
backend at some point; if none of these services are in ENABLED_SERVICES
then the error message is skipped.

commit_message:
Removes "RPC not enabled" error message when no backend is needed

When no service needing a RPC backend is activated, no error message
should appear if a RPC backend is not installed. A simple check is
done on the services installation files to see which services need to
initialize a RPC backend at some point; if none of these services
are in ENABLED_SERVICES then the error message is skipped.

Change-Id: I4e47e0c675c74775b4ea53a00848ac1d777f0125
Fixes: bug #1167338

commit_message:
Add support to clear DB

Fixes bug 1171740

The method cleanup() can be called when a test is complete,
for example in the tearDown method.

Change-Id: Id30bcb0d7ef167f6cb3b1bdea06f6421e1234a86

From the blueprint I gather that you are solving for trying to be more efficient with memory when the hypervisor may not statically allocate all the VM's memory immediately?  So you are testing against more of a snapshot of current memory usage rather than maximum memory usage on a given compute host?  

I'm not crazy about re-naming the filters and having to update nova configs.  What's "predictive" about the renamed filters anyway?  I don't follow the name choice.

It's generally pretty confusing with two types of ram filters, one that uses the memory info from compute_nodes and the other that pulls separate ram info from compute_node_stats.  I wonder if it would be clearer all around if all the usage stats were in compute_node_stats, rather than compute_nodes.  (topic for another patch, certainly)

One other concern is that only the libvirt driver will be publishing usage stats.    Do we have to manually disable the usage scheduler filters if not using libvirt or will they become a no-op?  Is it tested?'}, {'account_id': 6450, 'date': '2013-02-01 14:22:17.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 25.'}, {'account_id': 6450, 'date': '2013-02-01 14:56:48.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 25:

That's correct. For CPU usage we store a configurable number of samples and calculate an average based on them.

I fully agree with you about the naming. In our original patch, we didn't rename them. This was something that came up during review. Maybe we should reconsider that move?

I also agree with you that all stats should be in compute_node_stats, but don't think we should involve that in this patch.

The usage filters are not enabled by default. They must be actively configured in nova.conf. I have updated the code to  make sure that they don't interfere with other drivers. I have also added tests to verify that they become a no-op."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-02-01 15:05:20.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 25: Doesn't seem to work

'}, {'account_id': 679, 'date': '2013-02-06 21:32:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 26: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

'}, {'account_id': 1849, 'date': '2013-02-06 23:08:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 26: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

'}, {'account_id': 2750, 'date': '2013-02-12 11:54:57.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 26: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

I feel like this is a pretty big change, kind of late in the game, and adds a set of infrastructure on collecting CPU utilization which might be better met by Ceilometer in Havana (or at least we need a good understanding how the things interact).

With that I'd rather this waited until Havana, and preferably was a design summit topic to think this one through with how it would interact with other data collectors."}, {'account_id': 24, 'date': '2013-02-12 16:30:45.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 26: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(2 inline comments)

"}, {'account_id': 6450, 'date': '2013-02-18 13:22:10.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 26:

@Sean:

While I agree that collecting usage stats eventually should be done external to the Scheduler (i.e in Ceilometer), I don't think it should stop us from moving forward with this change right now.

There is nothing that stops us from later going back and change the source of these stats after a summit discussion about the future of scheduler data collection.

Further, as I see it we in fact make use of the existing infrastructure for collecting stats, merely adding another set of values back from the virt driver and dealing with them mostly the same way as the existing ones.

Additionally, I would argue that this is a rather safe addition since added stats are only used by filters and weighers that are not enabled by default, meaning no deployments are affected unless this functionality is explicitly enabled.

With that, if you still think that this should wait until Havana, I will withdraw this patch for now."}, {'account_id': 2750, 'date': '2013-02-18 14:49:46.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 26:

anything that adds config variables isn't something we should do lightly, as it's a long process to deprecate and remove them later if we decide to go a radically different direction in Havana, which with ceil in core, I can't imagine we wouldn't.

I think this is just too much too late."}, {'account_id': 2750, 'date': '2013-02-19 14:12:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 26: Do not merge

too big for this stage of grizzly, lets pick this up for havana'}, {'account_id': 2308, 'date': '2013-02-21 11:45:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 26:

@Sean and reviewers:
  As this patch is postponed from Grizzly, I would like to know your opinion about options to move forward. 

1. Break the patch into separated parts. For example, the first part is the monitoring of CPU/memory utilization while the second part is the scheduler. The first can be implemented in Ceilometer while the second still resides in Nova.
2. Propose an Openstack summit topic in https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Summit.

Any other suggestions are welcome.'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-03-01 06:03:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 26: Abandoned

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-03-01 06:03:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 26:

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}]

commit_message:
Adds utilization based scheduling

Extends state reporting to include up-to-date resource utilization of
hosts. Adds claims support and stats profiling to resource tracker.
Adds scheduler filters and weighers that exploit the added stats.

DocImpact
Implements: blueprint utilization-based-scheduling
Change-Id: Ic47c26e79d36392d16421168bab496d9381989d9

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-04-25 09:56:05.000000000', 'message': "Clear volumes stuck in 'downloading'

If the CinderVolume service is restarted while an image-copy is
happening, the volume gets left in a 'downloading' state and
cannot be used or deleted. This fix adds code to init_host to
look for volumes (on this host) in such a state, and move them
to an error state. It also calls clear_download in the driver
in case the driver needs to perform an action, such as
detaching the volume.

Fixes Bug #1172645

Change-Id: Ia5dab9ebf997f573c0b4e57d983f5996af81ede5
"}, {'created': '2013-04-25 11:28:31.000000000', 'message': "Clear volumes stuck in 'downloading'

If the CinderVolume service is restarted while an image-copy is
happening, the volume gets left in a 'downloading' state and
cannot be used or deleted. This fix adds code to init_host to
look for volumes (on this host) in such a state, and move them
to an error state. It also calls clear_download in the driver
in case the driver needs to perform an action, such as
detaching the volume.

Fixes Bug #1172645

Change-Id: Ia5dab9ebf997f573c0b4e57d983f5996af81ede5
"}]
commit_message:
Clear volumes stuck in 'downloading'

If the CinderVolume service is restarted while an image-copy is
happening, the volume gets left in a 'downloading' state and
cannot be used or deleted. This fix adds code to init_host to
look for volumes (on this host) in such a state, and move them
to an error state. It also calls clear_download in the driver
in case the driver needs to perform an action, such as
detaching the volume.

Fixes Bug #1172645

Change-Id: Ia5dab9ebf997f573c0b4e57d983f5996af81ede5

commit_message:
Update to latest copy of OSLO incubator

Specifically I wanted the change be84db3ab24ef94b6ec457bb299d48c51575e8a6
to oslo-incubator to fix my logging issue.

I ignored the changes in common/policy.py as this change breaks
the cinder unit tests.

Fixes bug: 1170038

Change-Id: Id72417d58c8f4bf139aa082131154153a175689d

Fixes bug 1172503

Change-Id: I8e475fe38d96ca663fbaac40c5a50420d791f5d5

commit_message:
Fixes 3PAR FC driver synchronization

While running  stress tests we found missing synchronized methods.
This patch added synchronized anotations around the necessary
methods.

Fixes bug 1172503

Change-Id: I8e475fe38d96ca663fbaac40c5a50420d791f5d5

commit_message:
Drop dependency on apt module.

Nova doesn't appear to have any direct dependencies on apt so we
should drop this.

Change-Id: I9b9580db655b129d41fed4ac35a999c1a1c639c7

'}, {'account_id': 6537, 'date': '2013-04-09 15:17:17.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

thanks for looking at this.  the reason i didn't implement a patch was because i was thinking it would be better to just store values based on what is received instead of modifying them. eg. capturing as MB or GB dependent on what is received.

there is also the differences between how OS represent a KB (either 1024 or 1000?).

also, i confirmed volume.size is passed as GB value but counter reports B so that at the very least needs to be fixed as well."}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2013-04-09 15:19:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

I thought we agreed to record the values with the most precision *as they are measured*. That would mean not converting the values ourselves at all, and just reporting the units for the values accurately."}, {'account_id': 1669, 'date': '2013-04-09 16:41:27.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

Yeah, I wasn't sure on what we agreed on such cases so I came up with one version of the patch, since it was a 50/50.

Well, it seems I lost, I'll rework it the other way around. :-)"}, {'account_id': 1669, 'date': '2013-04-10 15:04:00.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-04-10 15:12:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Works for me

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-04-12 10:44:08.000000000', 'message': 'Add support for volume backups

Implements support for the volume backup api added to cinder in
https://review.openstack.org/19468. This is a resubmit of the
expired change https://review.openstack.org/25299 with unit
tests added and some problems fixed.

Adds backup_create, backup_show, backup_list, backup_delete
and backup_restore to both the v1 and v2 clients, since the
volume backup extension is available via both apis.

Change-Id: I197384f1c2fd2af641d207a5f4dba0dfbc5c681a

Implements support for the volume backup api added to cinder in
https://review.openstack.org/19468. This is a resubmit of the
expired change https://review.openstack.org/25299 with the
following changes:

* Added unit tests for v2 backups
* Changed references in backup code to display_name and
  display_description to name and description respectively
* Removed links from backup-show output
* Added object_count to _translate_backup_keys
* Removed unneccesary items from _translate_backup_keys
* Fixed backups docstrings including removing references to swift.

Adds backup-create, backup-delete, backup-list, backup-restore
and backup-show to both the v1 and v2 clients, since the volume
backup extension is available via both APIs.

Change-Id: I197384f1c2fd2af641d207a5f4dba0dfbc5c681a
'}, {'created': '2013-04-15 08:21:50.000000000', 'message': 'Add support for volume backups

commit_message:
Add support for volume backups

Implements support for the volume backup api added to cinder in
https://review.openstack.org/19468. This is a resubmit of the
expired change https://review.openstack.org/25299 with the
following changes:

* Added unit tests for backups (v1 and v2)
* Changed references in backup code to display_name and
  display_description to name and description respectively
* Removed links from backup-show output
* Added object_count to _translate_backup_keys
* Removed unneccesary items from _translate_backup_keys
* Fixed backups docstrings including removing references to swift.

Adds backup-create, backup-delete, backup-list, backup-restore
and backup-show to both the v1 and v2 clients, since the volume
backup extension is available via both APIs.

Change-Id: I197384f1c2fd2af641d207a5f4dba0dfbc5c681a

commit_message:
Encode username and password in config file

Encode username and password in xml file with base64.
And change lun owning controller when attaching
the lun to get better performance.

Fixes bug: 1136892

[{'created': '2013-04-25 23:30:09.000000000', 'message': 'Wrong proxy port for Spice proxy

If we look at nova/cmd/spicehtml5proxy.py, we use 6082 port for Spice proxy.

In nova.conf, the default port for html5proxy_base_url is 6080 which fails console
service.

Fix bug #1172957

See also https://review.openstack.org/#/c/27524/

Change-Id: I3d7df3bfc7e0520024bbbe409aa9ae5735982f9e
'}]
commit_message:
Wrong proxy port for Spice proxy

If we look at nova/cmd/spicehtml5proxy.py, we use 6082 port for Spice proxy.

In nova.conf, the default port for html5proxy_base_url is 6080 which fails console
service.

Fix bug #1172957

See also https://review.openstack.org/#/c/27524/

Change-Id: I3d7df3bfc7e0520024bbbe409aa9ae5735982f9e

commit_message:
Missing image-del func in test_create_delete_image

* Test Case test_create_delete_image is missing image-delete
  functionality and the image is left undeleted after running this
  test. So adding image-delete functionality to test the delete
  function.

* This is a smoke test that tests create & delete image functionality.

Change-Id: I14fa4e65b83791f3effc2ca5694d363e2b7f09bd

commit_message:
Clean up servers created in test_multiple_create.py

Now several servers are created in test_multiple_create.py but
the servers are not deleted when the test finishes.
This makes the servers be deleted by fixing the way of
appending them to cls.servers.

Fixes bug: 1171697

Change-Id: Ie6768a6ecafb16e277964ca82201be213f885f4e

[{'created': '2013-04-25 23:21:50.000000000', 'message': 'Wrong proxy port in nova.conf for Spice proxy

If we look at nova/cmd/spicehtml5proxy.py, we use 6082 port for Spice proxy.

In nova.conf, the default port for html5proxy_base_url is 6080 which fails console
service.

Fix bug #1172957

Change-Id: I52ca37f76e7a6abd085b079ae42e7914cb619ad5
'}]
commit_message:
Wrong proxy port in nova.conf for Spice proxy

If we look at nova/cmd/spicehtml5proxy.py, we use 6082 port for Spice proxy.

In nova.conf, the default port for html5proxy_base_url is 6080 which fails console
service.

Fix bug #1172957

Change-Id: I52ca37f76e7a6abd085b079ae42e7914cb619ad5

commit_message:
Proposing Flavio Percoco as maintainer for strutils.py

I'd like to propose myself as maintainer for strutils. My last
contribution to this module is the safe_encode / safe_decode patch
currently being used by other projects throughout OpenStack.

Change-Id: I0e404e068ba8807ceb242ae5b90dbd26bdac1e22

 * a workaround for a hgtools/setuptools bug
 * install pycrypto and lxml as pip dependencies to ensure overrding

Change-Id: I089c07da32d211d25b14ce62cb61d2e3e8e6bb9f

commit_message:
Add a RHEL6 post-prereq phase

Add some post-prereq actions for RHEL6:

 * pre-install dbus to avoid the service not having ever been started
 * a workaround for a hgtools/setuptools bug
 * install pycrypto and lxml as pip dependencies to ensure overrding
   of local versions
 * fix-up a dependency issue with prettytable by pre-installing

Change-Id: I089c07da32d211d25b14ce62cb61d2e3e8e6bb9f

Python's logging module does not provide access to control the permissions directly. Presumably someone needed to do that, so it was added here. What is the motivation for removing it? Is there a bug?"}, {'account_id': 6969, 'date': '2013-04-25 14:36:48.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

I have a cron job that logs a lot of useless information to a file. I want to change this to log to /dev/null. But I don't have permission to change the permissions on this file but I can write to it. I don't want to change the logging configuration as other services use the same configuration.

It is not the logging module role to be changing permissions on files. If the python logging can't write to the file in question then you will get an error and your program won't run and you need to manage this. If it can all is well.

If you are worried about permissions then I recommend using logrotate as you will probable want to role over your logs anyway.

If you really, really need this, you can create your own logging handler to do this and not force it on everyone else."}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2013-04-25 16:05:06.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

I think I buy Michael's argument that this isn't appropriate, but haven't given it much thought. Interested to hear more about what Doug thinks.

FWIW, I dug up the original commit - https://github.com/openstack/nova/commit/df0f06a - no explanation or justification"}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2013-04-25 16:06:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Ah, no ... this is it the original: https://github.com/openstack/nova/commit/4a26a6f'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2013-04-25 16:23:07.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Without the option, the only way for the process writing to the file to control the permissions on the file is via the process owner's umask. However, the umask also affects all other files created by the process. Log files aren't the only thing we ever write to the filesystem, right?

A NullHandler can be used to disable logging, if that's desired. (http://docs.python.org/2/library/logging.handlers.html#nullhandler)"}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2013-04-25 16:35:14.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

If you want to control the permissions, you can pre-create it right?

That's what we do in e.g. Fedora packaging AFAIR"}, {'account_id': 6969, 'date': '2013-04-25 16:42:30.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Ok, writing a handler (while easy to write) is very difficult to install without modifying code. So this option is out, sorry for suggesting it.

You don't need to change the permissions on the file from within the python process. Like Mark said you can pre-create it or just run chmod once a day in a cron after the file is rolled over, or configure logrotate correctly. If I could do that I would but I can't for my use-case."}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2013-04-25 17:23:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: No score

OK, if the common case is to have some outside entity manage the log file and its permissions, then we don't need to be doing it here."}, {'account_id': 5638, 'date': '2013-04-26 02:45:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

lgtm'}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2013-04-26 09:29:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me (core reviewer); Approved

'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-04-26 09:29:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: No score

Starting gate jobs.
http://status.openstack.org/zuul/'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-04-26 09:32:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Verified

commit_message:
Some tiny linter-appeasing tweaks.

- regexes should be raw strings to avoid accidental escaping
- Eliminate use of deprecated string module.
- Linewrapping, etc.
- Swapped out deprecated filter() calls for simple list comprehensions.
- Functions shouldn't redefine their own names.
- Marked a few things as @staticmethod where appropriate.

Change-Id: I9dae0ec65d568d691ae86d26f33aba82ad6a7abc

commit_message:
Keep snapshot in saving status after instance deleted

The snapshot would always be in the queued or SAVING status
after the VM is deleted or nova compute service is shutdown.
So I combined the review comments from the code review
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/24820 and review
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/25236, adding an error status
for image in glance, and make nove to update the glance image
status via python-glanceclient.

resolve bug 1143659
resolve bug 1064386

Change-Id: I663cfb32e30daf86fc52694bca0d8fcd15afe5ba

commit_message:
Fix debian compatibility

folsom and grizzly packages of debian have some changes about
apache and the offline css/js compression of horizon.

This commit sync the module with the debian changes.

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-04-11 03:41:31.000000000', 'message': "Don't try to split a list of memcache servers

The memcache_servers configuration option is declared as a ListOpt,
but when used in AuthProtocol.__init__(), we treat it as a string
to be split on ',', which is wrong.  Remove the .split().

No test is added because the memcache package may not be installed,
and I cannot see an easy method to only test this clause if it is
available.

Auth_token.py has moved from keystone to python-keystoneclient in
grizzly, so this patch is picked from python-keytoneclient.

Fixes bug 1086125.

Change-Id: Ifb0a18017d2407b3ccb2188b1a704c26997ba594
"}]
commit_message:
Don't try to split a list of memcache servers

The memcache_servers configuration option is declared as a ListOpt,
but when used in AuthProtocol.__init__(), we treat it as a string
to be split on ',', which is wrong.  Remove the .split().

No test is added because the memcache package may not be installed,
and I cannot see an easy method to only test this clause if it is
available.

Auth_token.py has moved from keystone to python-keystoneclient in
grizzly, so this patch is picked from python-keytoneclient.

Fixes bug 1086125.

Change-Id: Ifb0a18017d2407b3ccb2188b1a704c26997ba594

Nits only (probably only the one on the backref might be slightly more important)'}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2013-04-26 04:35:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Hi,
The PoolMonitorAssociation has dropped the monitor column - this requires a database migration.
Thanks
Gary"}, {'account_id': 2035, 'date': '2013-04-26 04:35:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

I agree with the intent of the change, but as per commentary on other reviews, I would like to see a focused test.  Would it be possible to test the model behavior directly rather than involving the wsgi stack?"}, {'account_id': 2035, 'date': '2013-04-26 04:35:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

I don't think the current testing approach is a good one (and I'm exploring an alternative), but it is consistent with existing tests and I'll approve on that basis."}, {'account_id': 6849, 'date': '2013-04-26 04:35:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Hi, Gary. Thank you for your note. I should have probably added a comment to my change.

The truth is, that sqlalchemy.orm.relationship() doesn't define a new column of a DB table. It's just a convenient way to define a model attribute which can be used later to retrieve associated entries from the referenced table.

It is also possible to use the "backref" argument to define a name of an attribute in the *referenced* model to retrieve associated instances of the *referencing* model.

So I've just moved the definition of the relationship() between HealthMonitor and PoolMonitorAssociation models to the HealMonitor class to set the "cascade" argument ("all, delete-orphan" to ensure that all corresponding PoolMonitorAssociation instances are deleted when a HealthMonitor instance is deleted).

Please note, that I use names "pools_poolmonitorassociations" and "monitor" (backref) to ensure that HealthMonitor and PoolMonitorAssociation attribute names stay the same.

Thanks.'}, {'account_id': 6849, 'date': '2013-04-26 04:35:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: (3 inline comments)

'}, {'account_id': 6849, 'date': '2013-04-26 04:35:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I totally agree with you that we shouldn't use the wsgi stack to test the DB model layer, but the problem is that most tests in this module actually do that. So, although we certainly have to rewrite them some day, I'm not sure this change should violate the "test pattern" this module uses.

Anyway, what do you think about something like this?
http://xsnippet.org/359469/'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-04-26 04:35:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: No score

commit_message:
Simplify delete_health_monitor() using cascades

Currently delete_health_monitor() emulates behaviour of
cascade deletion: when a HealthMonitor instance is deleted,
all corresponding PoolMonitorAssociations are queried and
deleted one by one. This can be done automatically by means
of SQLAlchemy if we set proper cascade flags on the relationship
between HealthMonitor and PoolMonitorAssociations models.

Fixes bug 1169107.

Change-Id: I674c381192719a56433f67be53a32203c36ebe2b

commit_message:
Consolidated api-paste.ini file

Load a single api-paste.ini file, specified by config
Delete unused paste.ini files
Update docs for new paste.ini and config arrangement

There will be a corresponding devstack change, and once this is in
I will email the packagers on the packaging implications

Change-Id: Ic10b1a486094d15bfd832f0f934e6268ec323085

Agreed, I am not an eventlet fan. Although, to be fair to eventlet, this is really a bug in Python: "raise" is equivalent to "raise sys.exc_info()", and that's basically never what you want unless by coincidence. In this example, any exception in state_set() would get re-raised if we used "raise" instead of "save_and_reraise_exception()".'}, {'account_id': 4328, 'date': '2013-04-25 12:40:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me (core reviewer); Approved

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-04-23 11:38:43.000000000', 'message': 'Mark resources as failed when creation aborted

Previously resources would be left in the CREATE_IN_PROGRESS state in the
event of a timeout or the thread being cancelled (due to a delete being
requested while the stack was still being created). We should instead put
these resources into the CREATE_FAILED state when this occurs, thus
creating an event with the reason.

Change-Id: I05956aa9ef26941b79cef9dbf0cb6a347047d199
'}]
commit_message:
Mark resources as failed when creation aborted

Previously resources would be left in the CREATE_IN_PROGRESS state in the
event of a timeout or the thread being cancelled (due to a delete being
requested while the stack was still being created). We should instead put
these resources into the CREATE_FAILED state when this occurs, thus
creating an event with the reason.

Change-Id: I05956aa9ef26941b79cef9dbf0cb6a347047d199

commit_message:
Create veth peer in namespace.

 * Update veth pair creation to set the namespace of the peer
   device on creation rather than subsequently adding it to the
   namespace.
 * This change supports kernels with limited namespace support
   (e.g. RHEL 6.5) so long as ovs_use_veth is set to True.
 * Addresses bug 1171727

Change-Id: I1885acc9934e7627bb9872703df7f5edf2980722

Build succeeded.

'}, {'account_id': 5263, 'date': '2013-04-22 18:31:43.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

A few things worth pointing out, though I don't expect they are blockers this early in the release cycle...

1. This is not a pure Python implementation and must be compiled at installation.

2. This is not hosted on pypi, but is merely indexed there.

3. I could not find any sign this is packaged in Debian/Ubuntu or Fedora/RHEL, even though it has been around for years.

4. I could not find any documentation clarifying the module's stable API/ABI versioning policy (though this is just a wrapper around a system C library and so it may not make sense for them to have one)."}, {'account_id': 1216, 'date': '2013-04-25 09:06:51.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Please hold on this. It seems BoundedSemaphore is pretty much a wrapper around the posix semaphore calls anyway and looks to be useable without converting everything to the multiprocessing module after all. I need to code it up and test to be certain. I'll update this once I get the results."}, {'account_id': 1216, 'date': '2013-04-26 02:45:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Abandoned

Yep, multiprocessing.BoundedSemaphore seems like a fine fit. Sorry for the noise.'}]

commit_message:
Allow additional attribute mappings in ldap

This is needed as a work around for objectclasses that require additional
attributes other than just what is supplied in user_id_attribute and
user_name_attribute.

Change-Id: Ie6cdd0534b8389f62f98fdca7d19bc0feb9c131f
Fixes: bug #1158077

Add auth_version to dispersion.conf.5

by Red Hat QA, see rhbz#955247.

commit_message:
Allow listing fixed_ips for a given compute host.

nova.db.fixed_ip_get_all_by_instance_host was removed in commit
bb867ce3948ddc23cf928ca3dda100a1a977896a, but was still used in
nova-manage. This patch works around the removal of the foreign
key that led to this method being removed.

Resolves bug 1163660.

Change-Id: Ieccd37c752e245558827615c098604d11ad3d945

Modifications to the RPM list to make devstack work on RHEL6.  Makes
various packages only install on Fedora distros; generally letting pip
install the missing dependencies on RHEL.

Additionally the Qpid package name is different in RHEL6 to Fedora.

Change-Id: If497099d27aa9cd80e1c1cee1aff2ed6b076d309

commit_message:
Modify RPM lists for RHEL6

Modifications to the RPM list to make devstack work on RHEL6.  Makes
various packages only install on Fedora distros; generally letting pip
install the missing dependencies on RHEL.

Additionally the Qpid package name is different in RHEL6 to Fedora.
Also a small re-write of the config file is required to avoid
authenication issues.

Change-Id: If497099d27aa9cd80e1c1cee1aff2ed6b076d309

commit_message:
Move auth_token config to .conf, key cache directories

auth_token configuration can now be read from the conf files
rather than the paste.ini files.

A key cache directory has been created for each of the 3 API services
under /var/cache/heat

This is the devstack change relating to
Heat Blueprint: keystone-middleware

This is related to this committed change:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/26351/

Devstack users will find Heat to be broken until this corresponding change
is approved.

Change-Id: If6f77f86a3eeb08a58b516725bd806e39ccedb50

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-04-16 18:51:04.000000000', 'message': "Fix require_map_reduce mim import

We don't import mim at the top level file anymore, so there's no way to
check against mim.Connection. And we can't blindly check for conn.conn since
other drivers like SQLAlchemy don't have a conn attributes. That's not part
of the Connection interface.

Change-Id: I25ea31d10bb7a28296676fbec4d2ad015d082cf1
Signed-off-by: Julien Danjou <julien@danjou.info>
"}]
commit_message:
Fix require_map_reduce mim import

We don't import mim at the top level file anymore, so there's no way to
check against mim.Connection. And we can't blindly check for conn.conn since
other drivers like SQLAlchemy don't have a conn attributes. That's not part
of the Connection interface.

Change-Id: I25ea31d10bb7a28296676fbec4d2ad015d082cf1
Signed-off-by: Julien Danjou <julien@danjou.info>

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-04-25 22:20:12.000000000', 'message': 'Simplify NVP plugin configuration

Fixes bug #1121605

This patch replacest the nvp_controller_connection configuration option
with a set of options more intutitive to user which also avoid
repetitions in ini files.

In order to simplify the configuration of the plugin, this patch also
removes named clusters. As the plugin supports a single cluster at
the moment, this can be simply specified in the [DEFAULT] configuration
section.

Also, this patch restrucures nvp_cluster.NvpCluster so that per-cluster
configuration options are not store anymore multiple times.

Change-Id: Id5f84220122d7c5f3239e3333cb772247d1ed05e

'}, {'created': '2013-04-25 22:20:12.000000000', 'message': 'Simplify NVP plugin configuration

Bug 1121605

This patch replaces nvp_controller_connection the configuration option
with a set options more intutitive to user which also avoid unnecessary
repetitions in ini files.

In order to simplify the configuration of the plugin, this patch also
removes named clusters. As the plugin supports a single cluster at
the moment, this can be simply specified in the [CLUSTER] configuration
section.

Also, this patch restrucures nvp_cluster.NvpCluster so that per-cluster
configuration options are not store anymore multiple times.

Conflicts:

	etc/quantum/plugins/nicira/nvp.ini

commit_message:
Simplify NVP plugin configuration

Fixes bug #1121605

This patch replacest the nvp_controller_connection configuration option
with a set of options more intutitive to user which also avoid
repetitions in ini files.

In order to simplify the configuration of the plugin, this patch also
removes named clusters. As the plugin supports a single cluster at
the moment, this can be simply specified in the [DEFAULT] configuration
section.

Also, this patch restrucures nvp_cluster.NvpCluster so that per-cluster
configuration options are not store anymore multiple times.

Change-Id: Id5f84220122d7c5f3239e3333cb772247d1ed05e

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-04-19 05:40:40.000000000', 'message': "Don't print the empty table on list operations.

Changes to strutils.safe_encode cause the empty
table to be printed out when no objects are actually
retrieved.

This patch just adds a check of the object list length
before calling strutils.safe_encode, if the length is NOT
> 0 we just return like we used to.

Change-Id: I57930b5210c975baa7c4510fcf82b17157e17788
"}]
commit_message:
Don't print the empty table on list operations.

Changes to strutils.safe_encode cause the empty
table to be printed out when no objects are actually
retrieved.

This patch just adds a check of the object list length
before calling strutils.safe_encode, if the length is NOT
> 0 we just return like we used to.

Change-Id: I57930b5210c975baa7c4510fcf82b17157e17788

commit_message:
Add simplejson into dependency.

Actually, keystone-client enforces simplejson.  We can do that too.

Change-Id: If8c082e55269766d7a0653f87d640f79bc8ad336

commit_message:
Mark LDAP password and admin_token secret

Add secret=True to LDAP password and admin_token
of keystone configuration.

Fix bug #1172195

[{'created': '2013-04-22 15:55:50.000000000', 'message': 'Remove skips in test server rescue

* Remove skips test_rescued_vm_add_remove_security_group
* Fixes two issues
    1. In remove_security_group pass self.sg_name instead of sg_id which was
        failing earlier.
    2. Before executing unrescue server operation, the server status seems to
       be active hence the bug 1126257. So adding a rescue operation at the
       start of the test to fix the bug

Fixes bug 1126257

Change-Id: Ie79b94b9cde0f35bb4ea5955bc284139d85123cb
'}]
commit_message:
Remove skips in test server rescue

* Remove skips test_rescued_vm_add_remove_security_group
* Fixes two issues
    1. In remove_security_group pass self.sg_name instead of sg_id which was
        failing earlier.
    2. Before executing unrescue server operation, the server status seems to
       be active hence the bug 1126257. So adding a rescue operation at the
       start of the test to fix the bug

Fixes bug 1126257

Change-Id: Ie79b94b9cde0f35bb4ea5955bc284139d85123cb

commit_message:
hypervisor-list use policy

Because the DB function requires admin context, if you set a policy
for the hypervisor-list function (compute_extension:hypervisors) to not
require admin the user must still be an admin.

If you set the policy to not require admin for hypervisor-list then
non-admin users should be able to run hypervisor-list.

This change makes it so that the administrator can set the policy
to non-admin if that's appropriate for their setup.

Change-Id: I8e09c17405d3b3e356acbe863a62f87c00346d4f

commit_message:
allow policy for host-describe

The implementation for host-describe requires that the user is an
administrator and the policy setting for compute_extension:hosts
wasn't applied.

An administrator should be able to set the policy so that
non-administrators can do host-describe if that's appropriate for
their environment.

This changes the implementation so that the compute_extension:hosts
policy applies to host-describe so that non-admins can do
host-describe if that's how the policy is configured.

Change-Id: Ifbea8dff4a29821c5919c1499db18c09e685db8e

'}, {'account_id': 5441, 'date': '2013-04-16 20:34:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

'}, {'account_id': 2835, 'date': '2013-04-18 16:25:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

The patch seems fine to fix the specific bug.

I question, though, whether there is a good reason to tag individual DB API functions as admin-only anymore.  We could solely test the user via the policy engine in the API, which would be more flexible anyway.'}, {'account_id': 5586, 'date': '2013-04-19 02:48:35.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

I'm not sure this is on the right way. 
1. There are many other API like: aggregates. It require admin. And like aggregates design, it's just visible to admin. How can we handle the other api policy with the same problem? Doed it violate the design?(I think non-admin user needn't operate on aggregates and host, they just need care server, network...etc, that they can use.)
2. If we allow non-admin user can list hosts, like this patch, why not remove the admin-require in DB function instead? I think it sounds more reasonable."}, {'account_id': 6486, 'date': '2013-04-19 20:28:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Ivan-Zhu - Thanks for reviewing! Regarding the approach to take (remove admin-require from the DB function), I considered a few different approaches, and sent a note to the mailing list:http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2013-April/007485.html . The response there was that elevating the context was safer so that's the approach I went with. I was trying to avoid picking an approach and having someone say use a different approach and then go back and forth, since I think any would work. I'm fine with elevating the context in other methods, too. Should that go in this commit or a separate one?"}, {'account_id': 1561, 'date': '2013-04-20 03:01:04.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Is there really a use case for ever allowing this for non-admin?"}, {'account_id': 5441, 'date': '2013-04-20 21:46:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Because it is just a list call I could see someone potentially wanting this available in their deployment.  It may not make sense for a public cloud environment but a controlled internal deployment may have some use for it.'}, {'account_id': 6486, 'date': '2013-04-22 00:54:19.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Russel - we've got a product that reported this problem because they plan to use it. My understanding is that they have a read-only admin role that they give access to this api for the gui."}, {'account_id': 5292, 'date': '2013-04-22 02:20:32.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Elevating context is safer, but given we're at the start of the development cycle perhaps the db approach is better as we have plenty of time to audit and check for security issues?"}, {'account_id': 5586, 'date': '2013-04-22 02:31:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

@Brant Knudson
agree with Chris, I prefer remove the db admin require.

@Andrew Laski
Should we consider to provide more fine-grained policy checking? Because if we set compute_extension:hosts : "" in policy.json, it also means non-admin can use host-update not only host-list. Of course, this patch just changes the host-list behavior.'}, {'account_id': 5441, 'date': '2013-04-22 20:08:31.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

@Ivan-Zhu yes, I think fine-grained policies would be helpful overall.  There's already a method for achieving that with an extra kwarg to the authorizer that most policies are using, like https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/stable/grizzly/nova/api/openstack/compute/contrib/flavorextraspecs.py#L65.

So with that in mind it looks like that should be added in with this change, hence the -1.  And I would like to see feedback from Russell as well."}, {'account_id': 6486, 'date': '2013-04-25 19:56:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Abandoned

The required change is more extensive than proposed.'}]

commit_message:
host-list use policy

Because the DB function requires an admin context, if you set a
policy for the host-list function (compute_extension:hosts) to not
require admin the user must still be an admin.

If you set the policy to not require admin for host-list then non-
admin users should be able to run host-list.

This change makes it so that the administrator can set the policy
to non-admin if that's appropriate for their setup.

Fixes bug 1168488

Change-Id: I1d2e5908deefa4445ed010485e245c7cd2bac63a

commit_message:
Fix to enable negative test image_invalid_metadata

Remove skips in test_images_oneserver

* Remove skip test_create_image_specify_invalid_metadata
* Fix assertRaises bug to match against exceptions.BadRequest instead
  of exceptions.OverLimit which was causing this test case to fail.

Fixes bug 1005423

Change-Id: I877122880085d1fd69abe1d6d5b730701084c4a9

[{'created': '2013-04-15 04:28:49.000000000', 'message': 'Add fixed-ip and floating-ip commands

Adds:
* fixed-ip commands: add, remove
* floating-ip commands: add, create, delete, list, remove
* floating-ip-poo command: list

Also uses NAME_ATTR in the Resource class if present to determine
the attribute to be used for searching in utils.find_resource()

Change-Id: Ifd8fa60f880fc4050dea182ac24553cc2c4bff15
'}]
commit_message:
Add fixed-ip and floating-ip commands

Adds:
* fixed-ip commands: add, remove
* floating-ip commands: add, create, delete, list, remove
* floating-ip-poo command: list

Also uses NAME_ATTR in the Resource class if present to determine
the attribute to be used for searching in utils.find_resource()

Change-Id: Ifd8fa60f880fc4050dea182ac24553cc2c4bff15

commit_message:
Make CLI tests python2.6 compatible

- adds setUpClass method to tempest.test.BaseTestCase
  to provide it instead of unittest.TestCase
- adds replacement for subprocess.check_output and CalledProcessError
- also ensures closing of devnull provided to check_output

Change-Id: I90382f8553baabc592a2bf7008d591d83f89f416

Adds examples of CLI and API queries to the V2 documentation.

This patch includes additional reST-formatted text that will add new/expanded examples of v2 API use to the existing documentation.
Fixes: bug #1160929

commit_message:
Fix bug in db.instance_type_destroy

Fix db.instance_type_destroy()
Corresponding instance_type_projects weren't deleted

Fix db.instance_type_acces_get_by_flavor_id method
Return [] list if there is no such instance_type
instead of AttributeError

Fixes bug 1172153

Change-Id: Ib1a9a23aa6e26711c198bf4a5059797044c44426

This looks great to me. It removes a lot of code duplication and makes everything look really clean, especially compared to how it was working before.

I tested this with devstack (all you need is backdoor_port=0 in the EXTRA_OPTS list in the localrc to enable this) and it seems to work fine.

There is just one little clean up you could do in coverage_ext.py, you left all the now unused rpcapi imports in the file.

Also, is there a way with the new base_rpcapi to catch this being unimplemented in a service. (is this even possible now?) commit_message:
Move get_backdoor_port to base rpc API.

Each service implemented the get_backdoor_port method individually.  This
patch moves the implementation of this method to the base rpc API
instead, and removes the now unnecessary code from each of the services.
The server side method was left on all of the managers for rpc backwards
copmatibility.  They can be removed on the next major rpc version bump
of those APIs.

Part of blueprint base-rpc-api.

Change-Id: Ia8838fafd80eb86a1c2d66f5e97370042d8d8c53

commit_message:
Deprecate conductor ping method.

Deprecate the ping() method of the conductor API in favor of the one
that comes with the base rpc API.

Part of blueprint base-rpc-api.

Change-Id: Iea46b7f6ce70f4919d0121433af2fd64d6346941

commit_message:
Update Quantum connectivity diagrams in networking and basic install guides

- Cleaned up visual presentation a bit
- Added quantum-metadata-agent to network nodes
- Added multiple network nodes

Change-Id: Ie4f553e89d0aef754b8132daff7c70f2b9d027d5
Fixes: bug #1152838

commit_message:
Adds image `create` and `delete` functionality.

We use the V1 API for `create` since it does not
yet exist in the V2 API in glanceclient.

For blueprint glance-client.

Change-Id: Ifa819c14f6a013f4530d16247a671e5a1c740a28

commit_message:
Functional tests use a clean cached db that is only created once.

This eliminates the need for 'glance-manage db_sync' to be called
once (and often twice) for every test.  db_sync is an expensive
operation because it must walk through ever database migration.
With this patch, the first time the db is created it is cached
before it is used.  Instead of creating the db in future tests
the cached file is copied.  An atexit() function is used to clean
up the file when the tests are complete.

fixes bug: 1172475
blueprint: refactoring-better-faster-stronger-functional-tests

Change-Id: I96e35c640256bf27ff17da0b5f558bda02906a07

commit_message:
Set the port of S3_URL to 8080 with swift3 enabled

Fixes: bug #1171608
The value of the port defaults to 3333 which is the
default for nova-objectstore.

Change-Id: If87df6a765bcfc4d467628411dceec72d5af412e

commit_message:
Read metadata from local heat-cfntools cache

Heat writes to /var/lib/heat-cfntools/cfn-init-data , and heat-cfntools
writes the last metadata it read to
/var/cache/heat-cfntools/last_metadata. We expect to run on first boot,
which is why we need the heat version. Then we also expect to run after
cfn-hup notices changes, so that is where the last_metadata comes from.

Change-Id: I781c74a10b419f84c6983ed2b4d54b47bfa7b605

commit_message:
Make main() return rather than call sys.exit

Fixes tests not all being run and also makes main() more directly
testable. Also adding tests for log messages when main() is called.
Finally adding argparse to requirements.txt to fix python 2.6

Change-Id: I7f152c9aa1e99d0fd3d763871c96cf60840e3ff7

commit_message:
Add an rpc API common to all services.

This patch adds an rpc API that is exposed by all services.  The methods
in this API exist in their own namespace and are versioned independently
of the main API for the service.

The first method for this API is a simple ping() method.  This method
exists in the conductor rpc API already, and could be more generally
useful.  Other methods will be added in later patches.

The base rpc API will be exposed from all services automatically unless
they override the create_rpc_dispatcher method in the base manager
class.  All services need to pass a service_name into the base manager
constructor.  Some services already did this, but now it's needed for
all of them.

Implements blueprint base-rpc-api.

Change-Id: I02ab1970578bc53ba26461b533d06d1055c2d88e

[{'created': '2013-04-17 10:24:38.000000000', 'message': "Fix powervm driver resize instance error

During resize operation in powervm, the logical volume
of the instance will be copy and compressed to a file,
current logic decompressed twise before copying this file
to a new volume which will cause the new instance couldn't
be boot up.

Fixes bug #1169848

Change-Id: I91f536919511aafbf7dbe14abbee48dbceb189b2

of the instance will be copied and compressed to a file.
Current logic decompresses it twice before copying this file
to a new volume which will cause the new instance to not
boot properly.

Fixes bug #1169848

Change-Id: I91f536919511aafbf7dbe14abbee48dbceb189b2
