commit_message:
Fix powervm driver resize instance error

During a resize operation in powervm, the logical volume
of the instance will be copied and compressed to a file.
Current logic decompresses it twice before copying this file
to a new volume which will cause the new instance to not
boot properly.

Fixes bug #1169848

Change-Id: I91f536919511aafbf7dbe14abbee48dbceb189b2

subject: Fix NameError: name '_' is not defined
messages:
[{'account_id': 5638, 'date': '2013-04-25 14:43:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

lgtm'}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2013-04-25 14:44:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

This presumably was caused by If4125d6bcbde63df95de129ac5c83b4a6d6f130a'}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2013-04-25 14:48:25.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Do not merge

This works fine with me for tox - could you explain how you're running the tests so I can reproduce?

The fix is wrong, but we should be able to fix it correctly. It's wrong, because nova.exception should be able to assume that _() is installed and that the default translation domain is 'nova'.

Only library code should use gettextutils._() - i.e. code that could be imported by a process whose default translation domain is not 'nova'"}, {'account_id': 6593, 'date': '2013-04-25 15:07:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Abandoned

See email, looking forward to a solution.'}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2013-04-25 16:10:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

bug filed as bug #1172774'}]

commit_message:
Fix NameError: name '_' is not defined

During running unit tests, I get this error:
  File "/var/lib/openstack-nova-test/nova/cells/rpcapi.py", line 27, in <module>
     from nova import exception
  File "/var/lib/openstack-nova-test/nova/exception.py", line 123, in <module>
     class NovaException(Exception):
  File "/var/lib/openstack-nova-test/nova/exception.py", line 131, in NovaException
     message = _("An unknown exception occurred.")
  NameError: name '_' is not defined

Change-Id: I6c75e8241675895c1bd35baa48d5383c726fe585

commit_message:
Ceilometer configuration.rst file not using right param names for logging

configuration.rst file lists all the configuration parameters for ceilometer
configuration. However, for logging, these parameter names should be log_dir
and log_file, but currently it is logdir and logfile.

The table also misses log_config.

There should be a link in configuration.rst file to point a user to the
sample configuration file.

Change-Id: Ic96f303ee7e30faf23c0a6433af5cb5111d35616
fixes: bug #1171905

commit_message:
Translate NoMoreFloatingIps exception

When the pool of floating ips is exhausted the NoMoreFloatingIps exception
is raised but not handled properly in the floating ips extension resulting
in the exception propagating further up and causing a stack trace to be logged.

This change translates the exception explicitly into a HTTPNotFound, preserving the current
REST API behaviour. It fixes a bug where the pool name was not correctly inserted into
the message returned if allocation from a specific pool was requested.

Fixes bug 1169811

Part of blueprint no-stacktraces-in-logs

Change-Id: I8f35d25d065bb1fa709cff6f59841ac8c86658bd

[{'created': '2013-04-25 06:15:16.000000000', 'message': "Document image cache manager flag for compute nodes

In Folsom, image cache manager is disabled by default for compute nodes.
It's related to this bug : https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/1078594 when we use shared storage.

For infrastructures that don't use shared storage, it's very important to change this default from 0 to a defined value.
Otherwise, you could have some issue with disk space on your compute nodes after a while.

Fix bug #1172580

Change-Id: Ib6400d0b0a40cd4eb4911e9deefef14e33f18912
"}]
commit_message:
Document image cache manager flag for compute nodes

In Folsom, image cache manager is disabled by default for compute nodes.
It's related to this bug : https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/1078594 when we use shared storage.

For infrastructures that don't use shared storage, it's very important to change this default from 0 to a defined value.
Otherwise, you could have some issue with disk space on your compute nodes after a while.

Fix bug #1172580

Change-Id: Ib6400d0b0a40cd4eb4911e9deefef14e33f18912

This change adds the client side of shares service in Cinder.

Following CLI commands are supported:
    share-create        Creates new NAS storage (NFS or CIFS).
    share-delete        Deletes NAS storage.
    share-list          List all NAS shares.
    share-allow         Allow access to the share.
    share-deny          Deny access to a share.
    share-show          Show details about a NAS share.
    share-snapshot-create
                        Add a new snapshot.
    share-snapshot-delete
                        Remove a snapshot.
    share-snapshot-list
                        List all the snapshots.
    share-snapshot-show
                        Show details about a snapshot.

Change-Id: Ib49fbe6417152571a5c64a94427b9ebf2081559b
'}]
commit_message:
Shares Service in Cinder.

This change adds the client side of shares service in Cinder.

Following CLI commands are supported:
    share-create        Creates new NAS storage (NFS or CIFS).
    share-delete        Deletes NAS storage.
    share-list          List all NAS shares.
    share-allow         Allow access to the share.
    share-deny          Deny access to a share.
    share-show          Show details about a NAS share.
    share-snapshot-create
                        Add a new snapshot.
    share-snapshot-delete
                        Remove a snapshot.
    share-snapshot-list
                        List all the snapshots.
    share-snapshot-show
                        Show details about a snapshot.

Change-Id: Ib49fbe6417152571a5c64a94427b9ebf2081559b

commit_message:
Add stats reporting to Nexenta Driver

Nexenta driver was never updated to report stats.
This change doesn't include support for backend_name assignment
via configs, there's some other work that will need to be
done to enable that.

Fixes bug: 1166607

Change-Id: Id9cfff24df8815a67e42393aa18fd41ac1b9e6b3

commit_message:
Send 400 error if device specification contains unexpected attributes

Bug #1171926

This patch simply enhances the validator for the 'devices' attribute
by verifying each element in the device list does not contain
unexpected attributes.

Change-Id: Id3fd182a7f711b482ad371752983264ad73b100f

commit_message:
Reorganize & split child functions into a child server

Instead of having the process launcher class be the one starting
child processes, keeping track of them, as well as having the functions
that the child process uses, it seems better to have the main process
launcher class only care about starting, tracking, and terminating child
servers and have the child functionality be separated.

Change-Id: I4b04aa2215050911bd0c873111cafc003b91d952

commit_message:
Avoid calling sudo in install_venv_common.py.

Updates our common venv installation routine so that it no longer
attempts to automatically install missing RPM packages via sudo
and instead just prints an error message and dies.

The primary motivation here was to avoid sudo altogether since
some people would rather not have the test suite run these sorts
of systems admin commands for them.

Change-Id: I350e5421a4dd3094217270d39547acaea0aeda3b

commit_message:
Add middleware to limit size of HTTP requests.

Adds a new RequestBodySizeLimiter middleware to guard against
really large HTTP requests. The default max request size is 112k
although this limit is configurable via the 'max_request_body_size'
config parameter.

commit_message:
Add enforcement for foreign key contraints with sqlite

Fixes bug 1171732

When creating an engine the called can indicate whether or
not to enforce the constraints for sqlite.

Change-Id: I1d5820376f60388c084afea500f807cd25541800

The code looks fine.  However, there is an important difference between the FixedLoopingCall from oslo compared to what was in nova.  I think it's worth documenting the behavior change in the commit message.

In nova, the interval was the time between the *end* of the last run and the start of the next run of the task.  The oslo code was updated such that the interval is the between the starts of the task runs, regardless of how long it takes."}, {'account_id': 2271, 'date': '2013-04-15 16:53:29.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-04-15 17:38:10.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Doesn't seem to work

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-04-09 03:37:40.000000000', 'message': "Import and convert to oslo loopingcall.

Import the oslo looping call implementation (which is a copy of
nova's), delete nova's local copy, convert all users to the new
location.

Change-Id: Ia62ce1988f5373c09146efa6b3b1d1dc094d50c4
"}, {'created': '2013-04-15 16:53:29.000000000', 'message': "Import and convert to oslo loopingcall.

Import the oslo looping call implementation (which is a copy of
nova's), delete nova's local copy, convert all users to the new
location.

It should be noted that the oslo implementation of
FixedIntervalLoopingCall measures time from the start of the
periodic task, not the end, so periodic tasks will run with a
constant frequency instead of the frequency changing depending on
how long the periodic task takes to run.

Change-Id: Ia62ce1988f5373c09146efa6b3b1d1dc094d50c4
"}, {'created': '2013-04-15 18:25:57.000000000', 'message': "Import and convert to oslo loopingcall.

Import the oslo looping call implementation (which is a copy of
nova's), delete nova's local copy, convert all users to the new
location.

It should be noted that the oslo implementation of
FixedIntervalLoopingCall measures time from the start of the
periodic task, not the end, so periodic tasks will run with a
constant frequency instead of the frequency changing depending on
how long the periodic task takes to run.

Change-Id: Ia62ce1988f5373c09146efa6b3b1d1dc094d50c4
"}]
commit_message:
Import and convert to oslo loopingcall.

Import the oslo looping call implementation (which is a copy of
nova's), delete nova's local copy, convert all users to the new
location.

It should be noted that the oslo implementation of
FixedIntervalLoopingCall measures time from the start of the
periodic task, not the end, so periodic tasks will run with a
constant frequency instead of the frequency changing depending on
how long the periodic task takes to run.

Change-Id: Ia62ce1988f5373c09146efa6b3b1d1dc094d50c4

commit_message:
Fixes test in response to optional hostname fix

Several tests have had their behavior changed
with the client appending the default host.
With that new behavior reversed in the client,
some tests use a username that contains an @,
causing an ambiguous case for the API to parse.
Deliberately including the host in the tests
fixes this.

Fixes Bug #1171559

Change-Id: I967eb4b21d8ca3e2c2721db6f362b8dac2551346

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-04-23 21:00:06.000000000', 'message': 'Add a MAINTAINERS file

Following on from discussions at the summit, add a file which explains
the idea of oslo-core being a group of generalists and that each API
in the incubator should have a specialist maintainer.

I've made a quick stab at capturing the status of APIs where its most
obvious. I'm thinking we let people submit changes to add themselves
to the file so they're on record saying "I'll maintain this".

Change-Id: I5e67f94dc77f14849dea425dec51896fed0d07ef
'}]
commit_message:
Add a MAINTAINERS file

Following on from discussions at the summit, add a file which explains
the idea of oslo-core being a group of generalists and that each API
in the incubator should have a specialist maintainer.

I've made a quick stab at capturing the status of APIs where its most
obvious. I'm thinking we let people submit changes to add themselves
to the file so they're on record saying "I'll maintain this".

Change-Id: I5e67f94dc77f14849dea425dec51896fed0d07ef

'}, {'account_id': 616, 'date': '2013-04-02 22:54:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

I would really prefer that the calling libraries (the ones that actually call eventlet.monkey_patch()) do this fixup. If it helps, maybe glanceclient can expose a top level function "fix_eventlet_monkeypatching()" that will let nova and cinder fix this bug more easily and with less duplication.

Also, I wonder if the switch from httplib to requests would resolve this issue?'}, {'account_id': 6159, 'date': '2013-04-03 09:17:32.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Hey,

I'm with Mark here. It doesn't feel right to fix this inside glanceclient and It seems to me that this issue might happen in other clients as well (since most / all clients use sync requests based on python-requests).

TBH, I don't think python-requests migration will fix this since it still uses socket and httplib under the hood. 

Here's my 0.02$: 

What about adding this fixes to oslo-incubator and make them available to other projects?

I'm thinking about something like:

from openstack.common import http 
http.HttpConnection (which could be either the eventlet one or the httplib one)

This may be needed even for the migration to python-requests so, I would do it anyway.

Thoughts?"}, {'account_id': 455, 'date': '2013-04-03 14:25:00.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

Mark, Flavio,

I (and some others I've chatted to) really believe this is the best fix here.

> I would really prefer that the calling libraries (the ones that actually call
> eventlet.monkey_patch()) do this fixup.

Its not obvious to me why this is desirable. (Though I could be missing something.) What is the advantage in makeing cinder/nova/<some previously working customer application> do something special to use the glanceclient library? Isn't it preferable that glanceclient 'just works' with both monkey patched and non-monkey patched applications, in the same way as other openstack clients currently do? This has been the case up until now with glanceclient, and is what I'm trying to achieve with this patch. (There's also the practical consideration of trying to make the required changes to cinder/nova at this point in the release cycle.)

Once the eventlet fix lands this change will simply be:

 try:
     from eventlet.green.httplib import HTTPSConnection
     from eventlet.green.OpenSSL.SSL import GreenConnection as ConnectionType
 except ImportError:
     from httplib import HTTPSConnection
     from OpenSSL.SSL import Connection as ConnectionType

Which is seems to be analagous (except using OpenSSL) to what's currently in swiftclient:

 try:
     from eventlet.green.httplib import HTTPException, HTTPSConnection
 except ImportError:
     from httplib import HTTPException, HTTPSConnection

 try:
     from swift.common.bufferedhttp \
         import BufferedHTTPConnection as HTTPConnection
 except ImportError:
     try:
         from eventlet.green.httplib import HTTPConnection
     except ImportError:
         from httplib import HTTPConnection

Note that this fix is specific to glanceclient. The other clients do not suffer from
WantReadError exceptions. It is required to fix a side effect of the support for disabling ssl compression which can give up to a 5x performance improvement when using https (ie this is the purpose of the OpenSSLDelegator).

Bearing the user of glanceclient in mind, its worth remembering that because of this issue,
accessing glance using https from cinder/nova does not currently work."}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-04-11 06:03:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Abandoned

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-04-11 06:03:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 6159, 'date': '2013-04-19 12:28:34.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

Hi Stuart,

Sorry for the delay in the review of this patch.

Have you had a chance to see why this doesn't happen in other clients? I'm curious because, AFAIK, most of the other clients use requests, whereas glanceclient doesn't. 

I did a small test (pls, let me know if it is valid) and it seems that requests does fix this issue:

  >>> import eventlet
  >>> eventlet.monkey_patch()
  >>> import requests
  >>> r = requests.get('https://api.github.com', auth=('flaper87', 'MYSUPERPASSWORD'))
  >>> r.status_code
  200
  >>> r.content
  ......

Requests wraps ssl sockets before sending the request, so, that might be the reason:

https://github.com/kennethreitz/requests/blob/master/requests/packages/urllib3/util.py#L345

Cheers,
FF"}, {'account_id': 455, 'date': '2013-04-22 14:37:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Mark and I had a great chat at the summit and quickly agreed a way forward (tweak the patch to only use eventlet if socket has actually been monkey patched). I hope to push up a new patch real soon.'}, {'account_id': 455, 'date': '2013-04-23 13:54:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Restored

Restoring so I can push up a new patch set.'}, {'account_id': 455, 'date': '2013-04-23 13:54:25.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-04-23 14:39:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Works for me

commit_message:
Prevent WantReadError when using https

If the glance client is instantiated when the socket module has been
monkey patched requests to the server can yield a WantReadError because
the socket has been set to non-blocking but this is not being handled
correctly. When this is the case use eventlet's GreenConnection which
handles non-blocking sockets correctly.

Also, for now, add a required getsockopt method to GreenConnection.
This can be removed once the eventlet fix
(https://bitbucket.org/eventlet/eventlet/commits/609f230) lands.

Fixes bug 1157864.

Change-Id: I187b69f75b8bcfe16facd41e69b1cd0490dae605

so that devstack changes don't break us.

Change-Id: Ib7302894bfeb1016b15eba9e82312a7a915604fa
"}]
commit_message:
add database run check

check that the database that we think we should have used actually
created a log directory, which means it was installed. Not a
perfect check, but a starting point for double entry accounting
so that devstack changes don't break us.

Change-Id: Ib7302894bfeb1016b15eba9e82312a7a915604fa

In particular the step for changing the password appears to be the equivalent to the Fedora instruction for disabling Qpid authentication which I am adding. I assume that this should instead be an instruction for changing the password of RabbitMQ in the Ubuntu version.

For fedora/centos/rhel I am also adding steps to enable (using chkconfig) and start (using service) the qpidd service. Not sure if an equivalent for RabbitMQ is needed or I missed this occurring later in the guide?'}, {'account_id': 6843, 'date': '2013-04-17 14:48:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Yes, it says that on the web site and I would submit that it is incorrect and should be updated since the first paragraph of the book reads "This document helps anyone who wants to deploy OpenStack Grizzly for development purposes". This guide is designed to help one get started on Openstack. A comment about CA certs might be included in the install and deploy guide, not here.'}, {'account_id': 6843, 'date': '2013-04-17 15:01:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Sorry about the previous comment is should have been on another change. The set up for Qpid is incomplete. commit_message:
This is the first pass of a Centos;RHEL;Fedora version.

The process needs validation.

Patch set adds phrases to further separate distros.

Patch set goes through basic-install_controller-common.xml
with fixes during testing.

More fixes -- space after prompt, mark rabbit settings for ubuntu

Change-Id: I2726231917e90a1fdbff62c7d2455331bb7fefb1

Change-Id: Iac7db59af29e7cbb4891f36aa0456253c6395282

Move ec2token defaults from paste.ini to .conf

paste.ini files can now be considered not user-editable
(in normal circumstances)

commit_message:
Optionally allow ec2token config to come from .conf

Just like keystoneclient.middleware.auth_token
first checks paste.ini file then .conf file when fetching
a config value

Change-Id: I9db9744d0ab12fcf486de9a9d3f8e870a4ff66de

commit_message:
Remove quantum_connection_host parameter

quantum_connection_host parameter was not expected to work anyway
due to a typo in the logic in the class. quantum_connection_host
was removed from OpenStack with the release of Folsom.

It fixes a deprecation warning raised by Puppet:
Dynamic lookup of $quantum_host at nova/manifests/network/quantum.pp:27
is deprecated.

Additional changes:
* Remove commented parameters which were not used
* Add rspec tests for nova::network::quantum

Change-Id: I1d83511b0487de5ae694dae2b89bc265f6af27ca

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-04-17 00:40:48.000000000', 'message': 'Make migration tests postgres & mysql friendly.

Add some session commits to prevent database deadlocks.
Standardize session handling so failures don't leave open sessions.
Make raw sql statements postges compatible (' and " are not equivalent).

Change-Id: I0ef670ddc416a02e78570ab6ebed2b4bf2a8635b
'}, {'created': '2013-04-24 06:09:58.000000000', 'message': 'Make migration tests postgres & mysql friendly.

Add some session commits to prevent database deadlocks.
Force close all open sessions before performing tear down.
Use escaped parameter handling for raw sql statements.

Change-Id: I0ef670ddc416a02e78570ab6ebed2b4bf2a8635b
'}, {'created': '2013-04-24 06:25:18.000000000', 'message': 'Make migration tests postgres & mysql friendly.

'}]
commit_message:
Make migration tests postgres & mysql friendly.

Add some session commits to prevent database deadlocks.
Force close all open sessions before performing tear down.
Use escaped parameter handling for raw sql statements.

Change-Id: I0ef670ddc416a02e78570ab6ebed2b4bf2a8635b

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-04-16 03:54:08.000000000', 'message': 'Remove new constraint from migration downgrade.

Remove the foreign key constraint for user_id. Whilst it is a foreign
key the constraint was not set in the previous schema. Also sets the
columns names to unicode as they were in previous schema.

Fixes: bug 1169381
Change-Id: I9b1ac5305622d68a7e124ba8100a4b8166b43af0
'}]
commit_message:
Remove new constraint from migration downgrade.

Remove the foreign key constraint for user_id. Whilst it is a foreign
key the constraint was not set in the previous schema. Also sets the
columns names to unicode as they were in previous schema.

Fixes: bug 1169381
Change-Id: I9b1ac5305622d68a7e124ba8100a4b8166b43af0

commit_message:
Remove unnecessary full resource audits at the end of resizes

Both confirm_resize and revert_resize ends with full resource audits
which is unnecessary, given that correct calculations can be made
using existing claims.

Resolves bug 1169982.

Change-Id: If0f91651605a95e73fdbf88aa18c279bfaf73b04

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-03-26 23:15:36.000000000', 'message': 'Add post-prereq phase

This generic extra phase is handy for fixing up things like python
modules after pip is installed or other distro specific requirements.

For RHEL6, we add some post-prereq actions; a workaround for a hgtools
issue and install pycrypto and lxml as pip dependencies, overridding
the installed versions.

Change-Id: I4a68b830cd98c6f93191dac1edd7de2a0381feaa

commit_message:
Add a generic post-prereq phase

This generic extra phase is handy for fixing up things like python
modules after pip is installed or other distro specific requirements.

Change-Id: I4a68b830cd98c6f93191dac1edd7de2a0381feaa

'}, {'account_id': 2835, 'date': '2013-03-18 21:07:37.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Getting there!

Do you think we need a cell-friendly 'service_get_by_args' method?  I see you updated the api to just call service_update directly.  AFAICT the other usages are all within the cell already.  Just checking if it's useful before adding additional API stuffs to cells. :)"}, {'account_id': 4419, 'date': '2013-03-18 23:06:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

The service_get_by_args is mainly there for the future, and to get methods in one rpc version update.

I suspect that with big installs, the service index is gonna return a lot of info. So I predict that there will one day be a get_service openstack api extension method.

As there's no service_id in the top level cell, the only way to 'get' a (non-compute) service is with the hostname + binary_name.

Although, I can't come up with an actual use case right now, I'm thinking perhaps enable/disable work on more services than just compute in the future or something.

I'm happy to leave it out if no-one else shares this vision of the future."}, {'account_id': 2835, 'date': '2013-03-19 15:24:29.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: No score

My personal bias it remove code that's not being used."}, {'account_id': 4419, 'date': '2013-03-19 19:00:07.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-03-19 19:44:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Works for me

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-03-11 02:19:04.000000000', 'message': "Make os.services.update work with cells

WORK IN PROGRESS

In the nova.api.openstack.compute.contrib.services:

 * Make update work

In nova.compute.api:

 * Make update_service take host_name, binary_name -- instead of service_id
 * Rename some 'host' parameters to 'host_name' to be more explicit

In nova.compute.api.cells_api.HostAPI:

 Add these methods that exist in normal HostAPI

 * Add service_get_by_args
 * Add service_update

In cells:

 * Increase API version from 1.5 to 1.6
 * Add call_host_api_method
 * Add cast_host_api_method

 These methods work similarly to their compute api counterparts, but don't assume the first param to be an instance_uuid. However it does assume the first param contains a cellname and an object (eg. host_name) of some sort, and passes the object straight on to the HostAPI in the target cell.

Change-Id: I5651bd5bc328692df82f4d9da27d390a8c95e03f
"}, {'created': '2013-03-13 02:20:34.000000000', 'message': "Make os.services.update work with cells

In the nova.api.openstack.compute.contrib.services:

 * Make update (enable/disable) service work

In nova.compute.api.api.HostAPI:

 Add these methods:

 * service_get_by_args - Not used yet
 * service_update - Used by openstack api's services.py

In nova.compute.api.cells_api.HostAPI:

 Add these methods:

 * service_get_by_args - Not used yet
 * service_update - Used by openstack api's services.py

In cells:

 * Increase API version from 1.5 to 1.6
 * Add call_host_api_method
 * Add cast_host_api_method

 These methods work similarly to their compute api counterparts, but
 don't assume the first param to be an instance_uuid. However it does
 assume that the first parameter is a string usable by
 nova.cells.utils.split_cell_and_item.

Change-Id: I5651bd5bc328692df82f4d9da27d390a8c95e03f
"}, {'created': '2013-03-13 03:27:00.000000000', 'message': "Make os.services.update work with cells

commit_message:
Make os.services.update work with cells

In the nova.api.openstack.compute.contrib.services:

 * Make update (enable/disable) service work

In nova.compute.api.api.HostAPI:

 Add - service_update - Used by openstack api's services.py

In nova.compute.api.cells_api.HostAPI:

 Add - service_update - Used by openstack api's services.py

In cells:

 * Increase API version from 1.6 to 1.7
 * Add service_update

Fixes bug #1150499

Change-Id: I5651bd5bc328692df82f4d9da27d390a8c95e03f

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-04-18 23:26:47.000000000', 'message': "Fixes sorting on IP Address columns in tables.

The jQuery tablesorter plugin was choosing the digit parser
instead of the ipAddress parser for the IP Address columns.
This caused those columns to not sort correctly since only the
first 2 octects were looked at for sorting.

This patch adds an 'ip' data attribute to these columns and
updates the set_table_sorting function to set the ipAddress
sorter when this attribute is present.

Fixes bug 1108085

Change-Id: I3ca05048ce43b5bda14a4c586146c7ec9e479a79
"}]
commit_message:
Fixes sorting on IP Address columns in tables.

The jQuery tablesorter plugin was choosing the digit parser
instead of the ipAddress parser for the IP Address columns.
This caused those columns to not sort correctly since only the
first 2 octects were looked at for sorting.

This patch adds an 'ip' data attribute to these columns and
updates the set_table_sorting function to set the ipAddress
sorter when this attribute is present.

Fixes bug 1108085

Change-Id: I3ca05048ce43b5bda14a4c586146c7ec9e479a79

commit_message:
Add Filter Action to Instance Views

The Instances page in both admin section and project
section doesn't support the filter action yet. This
feature is however implemented for the Projects page
and Users page. So added this feature to the Instances
page.

Fixes bug #1169084

Change-Id: I76e77a61f032e96f2d8d69a22d2caab2108c2aa8

commit_message:
Enhancement on prompts to list selected objects.

Used the display name from table.get_object_display(datum), instead
of explicitly looking for the first occurance of table header that
contains 'Name'.

Fallback mode: tables with no valid get_object_display(datum)
won't list selected objects.

Fixes bug 1155821

Change-Id: Iff4ee8500eb57f39a9bcb199c7eb2be7fa3e4ec4

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-04-19 10:21:07.000000000', 'message': 'Fix regression on running manage command.

Options on the manage command (./run_tests.sh) is getting shuffled,
this is due to the logic how testopts and testargs are extracted.

For example, the command "./run_tests.sh -m startdashboard test
--target test" is being translated into "startdashboard --target
test test".

The options after the "-m" should be passed as is as argument to the
manage command.

Fixes bug 1164505.

Change-Id: Id1a0699050390014487459757b3bda9c7fcca405
'}]
commit_message:
Fix regression on running manage command.

Options on the manage command (./run_tests.sh) is getting shuffled,
this is due to the logic how testopts and testargs are extracted.

For example, the command "./run_tests.sh -m startdashboard test
--target test" is being translated into "startdashboard --target
test test".

The options after the "-m" should be passed as is as argument to the
manage command.

Fixes bug 1164505.

Change-Id: Id1a0699050390014487459757b3bda9c7fcca405

(4 inline comments)

"}, {'account_id': 2284, 'date': '2013-03-04 10:59:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10:

Thanks Mehdi, this is a great first step around which to structure a discussion and condense our efforts.

Just capturing some initial general thoughts that I've already expressed off-line ...

1. I've been leery from the get-go of metrics collection that relies entirely on AMQP as the publication/collection conduit.

The reason is that I'm concerned about sharing the *same* message-passing infrastructure as internal opentstack RPC, particularly "in extermis" ...  e.g. a situation where the root of the problem is that the message bus is running slowly, or is backed up, or is swamped with extraneous messages due to some bug. In that case, the metrics gathering (our "eyes and ears") would be compromised by the very problem that we'd want to be able to diagnose.

So I was envisaging that the metrics gathering would use an independent conduit, harnessing the flexibility that multi-publish offers in order to publish the metrics directly to a RESTful API  (either the cloudwatch PutMetricData API or a native analogue). 
   

2. IIUC, the threshold evaluation approach proposed is triggered by the arrival of a single metric datapoint?

This form of "in-stream evaluation" is a commonly suggested
approach to detecting threshold breaches. However it becomes problematic when the rule applies to a wide (as opposed to a narrow) metric dimension. By this I mean the difference between say "trigger when the CPU util for instance X exceeds 80%" and "trigger when the CPU util for all instances in auto-scaling group Y exceeds 80%".

Once non-narrow dimensions are involved, a single datapoint is no longer a really useful trigger for evaluation, instead periodic checking on the aggregated values tends to work better.

Also missing/delayed data detection can be awkward with in-stream evaluation.


Cheers,
Eoghan'}, {'account_id': 2813, 'date': '2013-03-07 13:37:38.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 11.'}, {'account_id': 2813, 'date': '2013-03-07 13:38:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11: Work In Progress

It just a upload with what I have done before Eoghan Glynn remarks and blueprints.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-03-07 13:51:55.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 11: Doesn't seem to work

 db instances if they want, but in the simple case use

[{'created': '2013-02-22 09:58:29.000000000', 'message': 'Initial implementation of ceilometer-alarm

The implemented use case is raising an alarm (i.e. executing something)
as soon as a cumulative counter is above or below a certain threshold.

Alarms are stored in alarms.json inside the config directory.

The cumulative counter is compared to the alarm threshold with the
operator in "comparaison_operator" field of the alarm.

The criteria handled to check if the alarm threshold needs to be checked
for a meter are for now only:
- counter_name
- resource_id

When a alarm is triggered a shell script is executed, same things when the
alarm is untriggered

The used shell script are stored in fields "ok_action" and "alarm_action" of the
alarm description.

The alarm status stays in memory as long as the alarms aren't stored in a
persistante storage.

This one update the DB and send a rpc message to ceilometer-alarm to
inform it for alarm creation/update/deletion.

This code is latest one for this prototype.
The summit have defined a more convenient way to acheive the alerting.

Change-Id: I2dfebc30a47576e83906a6d4011ce5d52041e901

commit_message:
Initial implementation of ceilometer-alarm

The implemented use case is raising an alarm (i.e. executing something)
as soon as a cumulative counter is above or below a certain threshold.

The result of the "statistic" during a "period" is compared
to the alarm "threshold" with the operator in "comparaison_operator"
field of the alarm.

The criteria handled to check if the alarm threshold needs to be checked
for a meter are for now only:
- counter_name
- resource_id

When a alarm is triggered a URL is called, same things when the
alarm is untriggered

The URLs are stored in fields "ok_action" and "alarm_action" of the
alarm description.

A api permit to made CRUD operation on the alarm.
This one update the DB and send a rpc message to ceilometer-alarm to
inform it for alarm creation/update/deletion.

This code is latest one for this prototype.
The summit have defined a more convenient way to acheive the alerting.

Change-Id: I2dfebc30a47576e83906a6d4011ce5d52041e901

commit_message:
Call monkey_patch before other modules are loaded

This patch moves the monkey_patch call into the glance scripts that
needs libs to be monkey_patched. This seems to be a good practice and
has given good results for other projects as well.

This change is needed  to avoid loading / initializing modules
before other libs are patched. For example: logging module.

Fixes bug 1163722

Change-Id: Idee486851606d765fb11598967a4f7d56cf46c97

commit_message:
Make deprecation-warning a debug-message

There's not much a 3rd party tool can do about this memcache
timeout-versus-time thing if it wants to support multiple versions of
Swift. So I just changed the warning message to a debug message so
it's at least easier to mute.

Change-Id: I9480a89a54af20c73b693ff358ff095363b459c7

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-04-24 06:22:23.000000000', 'message': 'Make "shared" filter more compatible with diff DBs

For the type BOOLEAN, in sqlalchemy,
it's mapped to BOOLEAN type if the backend database supports it,
otherwise, it's mapped to one of the Integer types, like SMALLINT,
and restrict the values to 1(True) and 0(False).

query_filter = (... | model.shared))
The above filter will generate a SQL where clause like:
where ... OR xxx.shared

This is not supported in databases which don't support BOOLEAN type.
Change it as below to make it more compatible:
query_filter = (... | model.shared == True))

It will generate a SQL where clause as below:
where ... OR xxx.shared = ?

In Python, True == 1, so this change is compatible
with both databases supporting BOOLEAN and those not supporting it.

Fix bug 1161195

Change-Id: Ic0ce0816d63b576a3469de0ed92cae4b19a3690e
'}]
commit_message:
Make "shared" filter more compatible with diff DBs

For the type BOOLEAN, in sqlalchemy,
it's mapped to BOOLEAN type if the backend database supports it,
otherwise, it's mapped to one of the Integer types, like SMALLINT,
and restrict the values to 1(True) and 0(False).

query_filter = (... | model.shared))
The above filter will generate a SQL where clause like:
where ... OR xxx.shared

This is not supported in databases which don't support BOOLEAN type.
Change it as below to make it more compatible:
query_filter = (... | model.shared == True))

It will generate a SQL where clause as below:
where ... OR xxx.shared = ?

In Python, True == 1, so this change is compatible
with both databases supporting BOOLEAN and those not supporting it.

Fix bug 1161195

Change-Id: Ic0ce0816d63b576a3469de0ed92cae4b19a3690e

Raise an exception if qemu-img fails

Raise an exception if the qemu image doesn't
exist or qemu-img fails. (LP: #1168318)

Signed-off-by: Chuck Short <chuck.short@canonical.com>

messages:

Build failed.  For information on how to proceed, see https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GerritJenkinsGithub#Test_Failures

- http://logs.openstack.org/25200/1/check/gate-nova-pep8/23450 : SUCCESS

"}, {'account_id': 659, 'date': '2013-03-23 03:54:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Pure master head got the same failure on my environment.'}, {'account_id': 1561, 'date': '2013-03-23 14:51:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Before this goes in, I would like to have a better way to manage rpc methods that we want to apply across all services.  Adding it to nova.manager is an easy way to expose the method, but there's no good way to handle versioning, and you have to manually add it to every client class, as well.

I would like to change things such that a given service can expose multiple APIs that are versioned independently."}, {'account_id': 659, 'date': '2013-03-26 15:25:34.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-03-26 16:06:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Works for me

Build succeeded.

- http://logs.openstack.org/25200/2/check/gate-nova-pep8/23609 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/25200/2/check/gate-nova-docs/17919 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/25200/2/check/gate-nova-python26/19327 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/25200/2/check/gate-nova-python26-rhel6/145 : SUCCESS (non-voting)
- http://logs.openstack.org/25200/2/check/gate-nova-python27/19415 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/25200/2/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-full/10521 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/25200/2/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-postgres-full/10237 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/25200/2/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-quantum/16072 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/25200/2/check/gate-nova-pylint/9849 : SUCCESS (non-voting)
'}, {'account_id': 659, 'date': '2013-03-26 16:16:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

This is my approach to share an API between services.
Please check nova/common/rpc_proxy.py.'}, {'account_id': 1561, 'date': '2013-03-27 13:25:04.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Do not merge

Thanks for looking at this.  I would like to get support for exposing multiple APIs in oslo.  I filed this blueprint here ...

https://blueprints.launchpad.net/oslo/+spec/rpc-multi-api

I haven't written any more detailed design for it yet, but I do have ideas about how I think it should look.  I'm hoping to implement this quickly.  If not, I will at least write down some notes on what I'm expecting here."}, {'account_id': 659, 'date': '2013-03-28 01:23:13.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Thank you for your review and comment. I'm waiting for the new capability of oslo."}, {'account_id': 1561, 'date': '2013-04-09 22:08:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Oslo patch here: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/26535/

Nova patch series starts here: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/26540/'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-04-24 06:03:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

code review expired after 2 weeks of no activity, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button  under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-04-24 06:03:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Abandoned

commit_message:
Add Service heartbeat driver with RPC.

This patch adds nova.servicegroup.drivers.rpc, a service
heartbeat driver using nova RPC. You can reduce DB updates
with it.

blueprint rpc-based-servicegroup-driver

Change-Id: I3fbd9258861c2b3ad5518ae3b63a61af18d21a40

Setting as WIP as I'm looking for a better solution (no conf variable at all)"}, {'account_id': 261, 'date': '2013-04-24 00:43:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: (2 inline comments)

'}, {'account_id': 261, 'date': '2013-04-24 00:43:50.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

I have reworked this patch following the same approach as nova.
the advantage is that a new configuration variable is not needed; the flipside is that we add a rule to policy.json whose goal is to define what an admin is.

However, since the default value will work for many deployments, user won't have to touch anything.

Please note that we also add a method for gathering the correct roles to be added to an admin context when the list of roles is not populated.
This is needed because often in the quantum code elevated context are initialized with context.elevated or get_admin_context and then fed to the policy engine, which then need to have the correct list of roles to evaluate rules.
This need should go away once authZ and business logic are decoupled."}, {'account_id': 261, 'date': '2013-04-24 00:43:50.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-04-24 00:43:50.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Doesn't seem to work

commit_message:
Make the 'admin' role configurable

Bug 1158434

This patch adds a new policy named 'context_is_admin' which defines
an admin user as a collection of roles or else. The quantum context
has been updated to check for this policy when setting the is_admin
flag.
This patch also adds a method for gathering 'admin' roles from policy
rules as current logic requires the context to be always populate with
the correct roles for admin rules, even when the context is implicitly
generated with get_admin_context or context.elevated.
Backward compatibility is ensuring by preserving the old behavior if
the 'context_is_admin' policy is not found in policy.json

Change-Id: I9acea75cca0c47e083a9149e358328ea3ca12d68

commit_message:
get context from req rather than getting a new admin context

This patch removes the call to context.get_admin_context() and instead
obtains the context from the req object. Allowing the context.auth_token
to be reused.

Fixes bug 1161081

Change-Id: I3b104edc2966fc3263fad824b1c4c99df832672e

Patch looks good - thanks for this.  Agree with Rushi about adding a test for auto.'}, {'account_id': 7255, 'date': '2013-04-17 21:26:50.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

Would testing the is_block helper added to utils be sufficient?

The issue is more that there isn't a block device I can rely on being available on a test system and it's somewhat annoying to stub out os.stat to make any file return the correct mode."}, {'account_id': 2243, 'date': '2013-04-18 06:32:31.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

I'm not too worried about your unit test, however I'm not sure about your assumptions regarding using blockio versus fileio in our particular implementation.

Fileio in fact it typically faster in the case of smaller IO sizes and also dependent upon on other work-load factors.  In the general case with KVM and using for virtualization fileio tends to offer better performance.

Regardless, I'm not too worried about any of this.  Providing the option seems like a worthwhile thing to do, and the reality is this is a change to the non-default iscsi target driver anyway.

The one thing I would ask is that the option is added to the cinder.conf.sample file with IET and we should note that this is an IET only option."}, {'account_id': 7255, 'date': '2013-04-18 08:44:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

@John,

Agreed. This change is more targeted at people using high-end arrays when additional buffer copies etc into the Linux page-cache (ala fileio in the IET case) are going to slow you down.

My hope is that this will not remain specific to IET as it is also applicable to LIO as far as I understand (I don't have much experience with TGT).

Happy to update the example config file, will post and additional patchset when I return from the summit with tests for the auto detection, cleanups WRT to importing volume.utils and example config changes."}, {'account_id': 4523, 'date': '2013-04-18 14:08:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

I have actually been looking at a similar change for LIO.

Does the current tgtd setup behave like block or fileio?'}, {'account_id': 7255, 'date': '2013-04-20 19:39:36.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 7255, 'date': '2013-04-20 20:04:34.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

@Eric,

I would assume TGT would be using page-cached IO (i.e. non-direct IO) by default. Don't quote me on this however, I am not a TGT expert."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-04-20 20:26:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Works for me

commit_message:
iscsi: Add ability to specify or autodetect block vs fileio

When using block devices to back iSCSI logical units it is
advantageous to use blockio as it decreases latency and
increases throughput, effect is especially pronounced with
faster backing storage devices.

Change-Id: Ia8cba5ddfe140cb5732c2b9ad882831e812a44bc

commit_message:
Add cinder::db::postgresql class.

This allows Cinder to be used with PostgreSQL.

Requires the puppetlabs/postgresql module. NOTE: I did add this
dependency to fixtures but did not add it to the Modulefile due
to the fact that the postgresql::python module hasn't been
released to puppetforge yet (although it is committed and tests
pass).

Change-Id: I3522d50935c81c8859c9f597df64aa0af6ca4e71

commit_message:
ensure postgresql actually runs on pg runs

it looks like devstack deprecation didn't hold entirely. We probably
need some deeper checks in devstack gate to make sure our working
environment looks like we think, but this should bring us back for
now.

Change-Id: I629d41e616be6bca8f494040d92b7773a20bb2c0

commit_message:
fix copying the mysql logs on completion

after telling jay that we were creating and archiving mysql slow
logs on every run, I was found to be a liar. This turns out to be
because we did shell expansion at the wrong point and got the
following in cleanup:

+ sudo cp '/var/log/mysql/*' ....-devstack-vm-full/logs/mysql/
cp: cannot stat `/var/log/mysql/*': No such file or directory

Do a cp -a instead to not fail on shell expansion

Change-Id: Ifd20ba17f7ff7d528697fbadd9f1d0178e7e7767

times.

commit_message:
Install polkit on Fedora/openSUSE when using nova

We clearly depend on polkit. It's usually already installed, but for
people using JeOS images, it's not.

Change-Id: Ieccd0ff569f7d4541833b98232aeebb36b3493cb

commit_message:
Add nova::db::postgresql class.

This allows Nova to be used with PostgreSQL.

Requires the puppetlabs/postgresql module. NOTE: I did add this
dependency to fixtures but did not add it to the Modulefile due
to the fact that the postgresql::python module hasn't been
released to puppetforge yet (although it is committed and tests
pass).

Change-Id: I3522d50935c81c8859c9f597df64aa0af6ca4e71

commit_message:
Add glance::db::postgresql class.

This allows Glance to be used with PostgreSQL.

Requires the puppetlabs/postgresql module. NOTE: I did add this
dependency to fixtures but did not add it to the Modulefile due
to the fact that the postgresql::python module hasn't been
released to puppetforge yet (although it is committed and tests
pass).

Change-Id: I3522d50935c81c8859c9f597df64aa0af6ca4e71

commit_message:
Fix the nova-consoleauth package name on Debian OS

It should be nova-consoleauth. nova-console is a package for the XCP
console.

Fixes bug 1171849

Change-Id: Ief008f423076b706c7a41ac164f665089e08a1da

Drop params require from mysql.pp.

require.

-1 for same discussion about passwords.

I think I see why the passwords are being included: in order to support multiple queuing services? If this is the case, would it work if the username and password params for both rabbit and qpid were renamed to "queue_user" and "queue_password" or something similar?'}, {'account_id': 7156, 'date': '2013-04-21 22:41:00.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(1 inline comment)

See inline comments.

Joe Topjian: There was a discussion in a previous review regarding the support of multiple RPC backends: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/26230/

Nothing officially came out of it. However we should try to come up with something or we will soon have 56 parameters for all RPC backends supported by OpenStack."}, {'account_id': 6859, 'date': '2013-04-21 22:45:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Mathieu: thank you for the link.

Perhaps we should treat queuing/rpc types similar to the volume drivers where it must be called as a separate class outside of cinder? This would work for nova as well.'}, {'account_id': 360, 'date': '2013-04-22 01:39:37.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-04-22 01:40:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Works for me

Build succeeded.

- http://logs.openstack.org/27231/2/check/gate-puppet-cinder-puppet-unit-2.6/31 : SUCCESS

'}, {'account_id': 360, 'date': '2013-04-22 01:48:45.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

mgagne: To your point about parameters. I personally prefer the module options to match what the upstream projects (Nova/Cinder, etc) are using. So rabbit_password and qpid_password seem fine to me. Trying to be clever and DRY them up would only confuse things I think (I'm against that). Also, these modules aren't that likely to change on a regular basis (they seem fairly stable).

If we don't add these qpid options I would like to see us remove all the rabbit options as well. While it is possible for me to configure qpid via cinder_config I would like to eliminate *all* rabbit options from my config files when using qpid (the default on RHEL)."}, {'account_id': 360, 'date': '2013-04-22 19:41:31.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-04-22 19:42:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Works for me

commit_message:
Add support for configuring qpid.

Support for qpid which uses dprince/qpid (posted on puppetforge).

Currently requires dprince/qpid 1.0.0 or greater.

Change-Id: I504e4aac985b50f9a64a19ec5445e5c2c39de720

I'm personally not comfortable with passwords in the manifest files. We had this very early on with these modules and worked toward removing them."}, {'account_id': 7156, 'date': '2013-04-21 22:34:59.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(4 inline comments)

Inline comments and same concerns as Joe Topjian. We need to have a guideline regarding passwords."}, {'account_id': 360, 'date': '2013-04-22 01:39:37.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-04-22 01:40:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Works for me

'}, {'account_id': 360, 'date': '2013-04-22 01:44:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Joe: The reason I added a default value for the rabbit_password was to avoid having to specify it when using an alternate message queue (qpid for example).

While it would be possible to be "clever" and DRY up these variables by using something like queue_password or something I would very much dislike that idea because to me it makes these modules more unusable. I much prefer the module options to match what we use in the upstream project codebase... So rabbit_password and qpid_password seem fine to me. Yes: this means we'll have more options in our puppet modules but I don't see a huge issue with that given that these configs are for message queues (which live in openstack common) and are somewhat likely to change on a regular basis.

As a "middle ground" solution I added a warning message that will get printed if you use the default rabbit_password. This also works well in my qpid branch (which depends on this one)'}, {'account_id': 6859, 'date': '2013-04-22 01:56:06.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Hi Dan: Thank you for the information. I understand where you're coming from now and don't necessarily disagree with the multi-rpc portion. I'd like to suggest moving this discussion out of gerrit and onto the mailing list. There might be other people interested in this / have input and it's really easy to miss discussions in Gerrit. I will start a thread."}, {'account_id': 360, 'date': '2013-04-22 02:01:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Joe: sounds good. BTW. In my previous post I meant to say that the RPC configs in the upstream projects are NOT likely to change that often (sorry about that).'}, {'account_id': 2243, 'date': '2013-04-22 15:39:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

'}, {'account_id': 360, 'date': '2013-04-22 19:41:31.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-04-22 19:42:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Works for me

commit_message:
Add cinder::rabbitmq class.

Updates the cinder module so that it supports full Rabbitmq
configuration for the Cinder service. Previously the Cinder module
piggy-backed on the Nova module for its Rabbitmq configuration.

It is now possible to configure Cinder with its own Rabbitmq
service/vhost/etc.

Change-Id: I1ce84d0716d333fe68d3a60ba7d7543c93a70ba3

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-04-20 04:27:14.000000000', 'message': "Made colons quote-safe in logs; mainly for ipv6

Previous logging made a mess of ipv6 addresses. This just makes the
colon quote-safe so it passes through unscathed. The logs will still
be backward compatible because unquote don't care:

    $ python
    >>> from urllib import quote, unquote
    >>> quote('2001:db8:85a3:8d3:1319:8a2e:370:7348')
    '2001%3Adb8%3A85a3%3A8d3%3A1319%3A8a2e%3A370%3A7348'
    >>> unquote(quote('2001:db8:85a3:8d3:1319:8a2e:370:7348'))
    '2001:db8:85a3:8d3:1319:8a2e:370:7348'
    >>> quote('2001:db8:85a3:8d3:1319:8a2e:370:7348', '/:')
    '2001:db8:85a3:8d3:1319:8a2e:370:7348'
    >>> unquote(quote('2001:db8:85a3:8d3:1319:8a2e:370:7348', '/:'))
    '2001:db8:85a3:8d3:1319:8a2e:370:7348'

Change-Id: Ia13a9bc8a320cde5c56034a7f0b645913428bf21
"}]
commit_message:
Made colons quote-safe in logs; mainly for ipv6

Previous logging made a mess of ipv6 addresses. This just makes the
colon quote-safe so it passes through unscathed. The logs will still
be backward compatible because unquote don't care:

    $ python
    >>> from urllib import quote, unquote
    >>> quote('2001:db8:85a3:8d3:1319:8a2e:370:7348')
    '2001%3Adb8%3A85a3%3A8d3%3A1319%3A8a2e%3A370%3A7348'
    >>> unquote(quote('2001:db8:85a3:8d3:1319:8a2e:370:7348'))
    '2001:db8:85a3:8d3:1319:8a2e:370:7348'
    >>> quote('2001:db8:85a3:8d3:1319:8a2e:370:7348', '/:')
    '2001:db8:85a3:8d3:1319:8a2e:370:7348'
    >>> unquote(quote('2001:db8:85a3:8d3:1319:8a2e:370:7348', '/:'))
    '2001:db8:85a3:8d3:1319:8a2e:370:7348'

Change-Id: Ia13a9bc8a320cde5c56034a7f0b645913428bf21

commit_message:
If rescue fails don't error the instance

If a rescue attempt fails, the VM's state should return to what it was
before the rescue attempt started, and the user should be notified of
the failure.

Fixes bug: 1170328

Change-Id: If5e97d06a3617adad83a4bba2ac6320616bbe83b

commit_message:
Encode consoleauth token in utf-8 to make it a str

This is needed for memcached backend, because the key cannot be a
unicode object in any of the exposed functions.

Fixes bug 1164784

Co-authored-by: Stanislaw Pitucha <stanislaw.pitucha@hp.com>

Change-Id: Ieb1429116d96eefe97564fe92631063dc16117cb

[{'account_id': 2243, 'date': '2013-04-10 17:33:07.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

So it's not that I don't want to make it easy to test drivers with devstack, I just don't like doing it this way.  I think it can get out of control rather quickly in terms of lib/cinder getting very messy.

I think we can do this in a more generic fashion, where localrc variable is used for *whatever* driver instead of hard-coding all of them in the cinder file.

I'll let the devstack pros determine if I'm off base here or not, but that's my opinion."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-04-10 17:53:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Works for me

commit_message:
Add support for GlusterFS Cinder driver

The GlusterFS volume driver can be used with Cinder by setting the
following in localrc:

CINDER_DRIVER=glusterfs
CINDER_GLUSTERFS_SHARES="127.0.0.1:/vol1;127.0.0.1:/vol2"

Shares are <host>:<volume> and separated by semicolons.

Change-Id: Iaa105233c9fce8d8fda0a9ea447e045b8d010db7

There is a concern on this change for the resolving.
Probably it's not good enough to check the disk type in different place twice: line #3374 and #3400.
So the other choice is compute the disk over committed size of the instance in "get_instance_disk_info" function,
and give a new field in the result such as "over_committed_disk_size", then "get_disk_over_committed_size_total" function can sum it directly.
This can keep perform disk type checking just in one place in, that's in "get_instance_disk_info" function.

Other handle, the key maybe about what's the definition about "virt_size" field, we can also give "virt_size" = "disk_size" directly on line #3379.
What's you comments? thx.'}, {'account_id': 4468, 'date': '2013-04-11 07:51:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

commit_message:
Correct disk's over committed size computing error

There's a error in the disk's over committed size computing for the
instance which using RAW type disk. This issue caused
disk_available_least resource counting increasing.

Fixes bug: 1167695

Change-Id: I4e6cf22a9cf66a757e3641e2a0be0b7699cae69d
Signed-off-by: Zhi Yan Liu <zhiyanl@cn.ibm.com>

commit_message:
Raise 404 while deleting a deleted image

Fixes bug 1171469

Currently the glance v1 api raises a HTTPForbidden when a user tries
to delete an already deleted image. It should be raising a HTTPNotFound.

Change-Id: I79f83782739bf40f3baba293cbc17fe04ca020bb

[{'created': '2013-04-23 18:01:55.000000000', 'message': "Add an rpc API common to all services.

This patch adds an rpc API that is exposed by all services.  The methods
in this API exist in their own namespace and are versioned independently
of the main API for the service.

The first method for this API is a simple ping() method.  This method
exists in the conductor rpc API already, and could be more generally

The base rpc API will be exposed from all services automatically unless

class.  All services need to pass a service_name into the base manager

Change-Id: I57c6183e38c7ac5613e1281054a506dc84c7e382
"}]
commit_message:
Add an rpc API common to all services.

This patch adds an rpc API that is exposed by all services.  The methods
in this API exist in their own namespace and are versioned independently
of the main API for the service.

The first method for this API is a simple ping() method.  This method
exists in the conductor rpc API already, and could be more generally
useful.  Other methods will be added in later patches.

The base rpc API will be exposed from all services automatically unless
they override the create_rpc_dispatcher method in the base manager
class.  All services need to pass a service_name into the base manager
constructor.  Some services already did this, but now it's needed for
all of them.

Implements blueprint base-rpc-api.

Change-Id: I57c6183e38c7ac5613e1281054a506dc84c7e382

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-04-22 01:16:34.000000000', 'message': 'Fix attach volume detect in euca test

Fixes test for detecting when a volume has been successfully
attached to an instance to not just rely on the state being
in-use, but also be marked as "attached". The attachment
state will be displayed when https://review.openstack.org/#/c/27098/
goes through. The attachment state is not currently displayed
by euca-describe-volumes because of the extraneous data returned
by the API as per bug #1074901.

In the meantime the "attaching" status of the volume itself, rather
than the attachment state, suffices for the test to work properly, but in the long
term this will disappear as it is not a valid ec2 API state and
volumes will move straight to the in-use state.

Fixes bug #1170548

Change-Id: Id38f37e1a0efc991f60da35145f809d98b5f41cd
'}]
commit_message:
Fix attach volume detect in euca test

Fixes test for detecting when a volume has been successfully
attached to an instance to not just rely on the state being
in-use, but also be marked as "attached". The attachment
state will be displayed when https://review.openstack.org/#/c/27098/
goes through. The attachment state is not currently displayed
by euca-describe-volumes because of the extraneous data returned
by the API as per bug #1074901.

In the meantime the "attaching" status of the volume itself, rather
than the attachment state, suffices for the test to work properly, but in the long
term this will disappear as it is not a valid ec2 API state and
volumes will move straight to the in-use state.

Fixes bug #1170548

Change-Id: Id38f37e1a0efc991f60da35145f809d98b5f41cd

commit_message:
Add rule for list_groups_for_user in policy.json

Providing an initial policy rule for the list_groups_for_user
operation in the sample policy.json file for the ease of
configuration.

Fixes bug #1167836

Change-Id: Id253729098a95d3b129babde1b3706f409a095dd

'}, {'account_id': 261, 'date': '2013-04-23 16:43:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: (2 inline comments)

Just a couple of questions and we're good to go!"}, {'account_id': 447, 'date': '2013-04-23 16:43:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

code looks ok, but i'm not super clear on the use case.  

Without understanding the use case, its kind of confusing that we tag with the quantum version on create but not update.  What is the goal here?  Just adding some info for an operator looking at a GUI?"}, {'account_id': 4395, 'date': '2013-04-23 16:43:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: (2 inline comments)

'}, {'account_id': 4395, 'date': '2013-04-23 16:43:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

NVP doesn't enforce you to repush the tags when you do an update so I didn't add them to any of the updates. 

The use case is so that we could update get_(networks/routers/ports) to filter on scope='quantum' so if one wanted to create things outside of quantum we would just ignore it (since they probably won't add a tag saying quantum). 

Having these tags here also allow us to delete things later from NVP if they have a quantum tag and they are not found in the quantum_db. The reason why this could happen is if we do a create port on nvp and the response times out when returning to quantum-server."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-04-23 16:43:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Works for me

Build succeeded.

commit_message:
Add string 'quantum'/ version to scope/tag in NVP

This patch adds scope='quantum', tag=QUANTUM_VERSION to each element
created in NVP via quantum. This patch also removes the function
set_tenant_id_tag() as it was only used in one place and wasn't very useful.

Fixes bug 1128674

Change-Id: I9f1f8e9b49154012a82d24e31cc9fb7f2df9c604

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-04-17 00:43:35.000000000', 'message': "Translate cinder NotFound exception

When we attempt to get information about a snapshot
which doesn't exist we get a cinder NotFound exception.
However, this is not caught and causes a stacktrace in the logs.
This occurs on every tempest run in the test
EC2VolumesTest.test_create_volume_from_snapshot.

The fix is to translate the exception to SnapshotNotFound
which is handled correctly further up the call chain.

Fixes bug 1169777

Part of blueprint no-stacktraces-in-logs

Change-Id: If893b5083b93894e671c978bd23bd89d3d017531
"}]
commit_message:
Translate cinder NotFound exception

When we attempt to get information about a snapshot
which doesn't exist we get a cinder NotFound exception.
However, this is not caught and causes a stacktrace in the logs.
This occurs on every tempest run in the test
EC2VolumesTest.test_create_volume_from_snapshot.

The fix is to translate the exception to SnapshotNotFound
which is handled correctly further up the call chain.

Fixes bug 1169777

Part of blueprint no-stacktraces-in-logs

Change-Id: If893b5083b93894e671c978bd23bd89d3d017531

[{'created': '2013-04-16 19:42:23.000000000', 'message': "hypervisor tests more accurate db

The hypervisor tests don't accurately model the db because the
sqlalchemy DB API requires admin for the compute_node_get_all
function.

This change makes it so that the fake compute_node_get_all
function in the hypervisor test module requires admin just like the
sqlalchemy DB function.

Change-Id: I5acd45cfbd10ec06d8c5a9425e9c6ed18cff669e
"}]
commit_message:
hypervisor tests more accurate db

The hypervisor tests don't accurately model the db because the
sqlalchemy DB API requires admin for the compute_node_get_all
function.

This change makes it so that the fake compute_node_get_all
function in the hypervisor test module requires admin just like the
sqlalchemy DB function.

Change-Id: I5acd45cfbd10ec06d8c5a9425e9c6ed18cff669e

commit_message:
Deprecate old vif drivers.

As per commit 4c0cecd3 (Change-Id I292c2fd7aa0c32b1c91d737152ed8e54ea2cf6ac)
Deprecate:
* LibvirtBridgeDriver
* LibvirtOpenVswitchDriver
* LibvirtHybridOVSBridgeDriver
* LibvirtOpenVswitchVirtualPortDriver
* QuantumLinuxBridgeVIFDriver

Change-Id: Iad854dfe91aaa18622f78aa92746d3ea2f986960

[{'created': '2013-04-17 17:22:13.000000000', 'message': "Update to latest copy of OSLO

Specially I wanted the change be84db3ab24ef94b6ec457bb299d48c51575e8a6
to oslo-incubator to fix my logging issue.

I didn't merge common/rpc/proxy.py as this change breaks the nova unit tests.

Fixes bug: 1170049

Change-Id: I007786604138c41fbcf1127c01339132c56a6aab
"}, {'created': '2013-04-17 17:37:17.000000000', 'message': 'Update the log module from oslo-incubator

Fixes bug: 1170049

Change-Id: I007786604138c41fbcf1127c01339132c56a6aab
'}, {'created': '2013-04-18 07:44:47.000000000', 'message': 'Update the log module from oslo-incubator

Contains fix to stop the logger system from logging events twice.

Change-Id: I007786604138c41fbcf1127c01339132c56a6aab
'}]
commit_message:
Update the log module from oslo-incubator

Contains fix to stop the logger system from logging events twice.

Also includes PID in default logging_context_format_string

Fixes bug: 1170049

Change-Id: I007786604138c41fbcf1127c01339132c56a6aab

commit_message:
Add option to exclude joins from instance_get_by_uuid

Some callers of instance_get_by_uuid do not need the data that it joins
by default.  This allows the caller the choice of getting it or not.
Specifically in this case the _sync_power_state periodic task is pulling
it unnecessarily.

Change-Id: I48cc2ea1de993b87ce6f96f4877c8d8513f507e2

when using ./run_tests.sh with -xintegration this test fails
with a duplicate option error, we shouldn't be running it there

subject: close db migration session
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 4, 'name': 'Dolph Mathews', 'email': 'dolph.mathews@gmail.com', 'username': 'dolph'}, {'_account_id': 6, 'name': 'Joe Heck', 'email': 'heckj@mac.com', 'username': 'heckj'}, {'_account_id': 2166, 'name': 'SmokeStack CI', 'username': 'smokestack', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 5292, 'name': 'Christopher Yeoh', 'email': 'cbkyeoh@gmail.com', 'username': 'cyeoh-0'}, {'_account_id': 5707, 'name': 'henry-nash', 'email': 'henry.nash@uk.ibm.com', 'username': 'henry-nash'}, {'_account_id': 6456, 'name': 'Sahdev Zala', 'email': 'spzala@us.ibm.com', 'username': 'spzala'}, {'_account_id': 6593, 'name': 'Dirk Mueller', 'email': 'dirk@dmllr.de', 'username': 'dmllr'}, {'_account_id': 7291, 'name': 'Malcolm Anderson', 'email': 'dufm1958@gmail.com'}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 4, 'date': '2013-03-21 22:58:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

How do you reproduce this? This should be an issue on nearly every migration across openstack and a sqlalchemy-migrate best practice"}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-03-21 23:06:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Works for me

Build succeeded.

- http://logs.openstack.org/25065/1/check/gate-keystone-pep8/4455 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/25065/1/check/gate-keystone-docs/2838 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/25065/1/check/gate-keystone-python26/3361 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/25065/1/check/gate-keystone-python26-rhel6/14 : SUCCESS (non-voting)
- http://logs.openstack.org/25065/1/check/gate-keystone-python27/3373 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/25065/1/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-full/9961 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/25065/1/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-postgres-full/9676 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/25065/1/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-quantum/15423 : SUCCESS
'}, {'account_id': 5292, 'date': '2013-03-22 02:01:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Dolph - As i mentioned on IRC https://review.openstack.org/#/c/23660/ picks this up. 

Although most other openstack projects have similar test_migrations testcases the problem isn't seen because they don't use orm.sessionmaker in db migrations (is there an assumption in other projects that no one is access the db during upgrades? Can we do the same here?). Perhaps this is also why it doesn't appear in best practice migration guides.

Triggering the problem using db_sync is not straightforward. The problem occurs only when a session is left unclosed or uncommited, the sqlalchemy engine is disposed of and then an attempt is made to drop the database. An error occurs because there is still an active connection to the db. This scenario of course won't happen during the normal operation of the keystone server.

I did check the the sqlalchemy engine dispose only guarantees closure of connections returned to the pool. This won't happen if the session is not closed or committed. From the docs:

"It is critical to note that dispose() does not guarantee that the application will release all open database connections - only those connections that are checked into the pool are closed. Connections which remain checked out or have been detached from the engine are not affected."

Is there a downside to having the session.close() in the db migrations?'}, {'account_id': 4, 'date': '2013-03-22 14:39:23.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I'm simply opposed to the inconsistency presented here, and would like to better understand and fix the underlying problem, if there is one.

Migrations 8, 9, 10, 12, 15, 16, 17, 20, 21 and 22 currently use sessionmaker

Migrations 9, 10, 12, 15, 16, 17, 20, and 22 use session.query()

Migrations 8, 10, 12, 15, 16 currently call session.commit()

Migrations 12, 15, 16, 17, and 20 currently call session.close()

So, migrations 9, 10 and 22 use sessionmaker and session.query() but don't call session.close() and -- so why isn't this fix necessary for migrations 9 and 10?"}, {'account_id': 5292, 'date': '2013-03-22 21:01:44.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

With migration 9 session maker is only used in the code path where SQLite is the engine so it doesn't trigger the problem. With migration 10 there is a session.commit in the function level above in upgrade/downgrade"}, {'account_id': 5292, 'date': '2013-03-22 21:07:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Sorry misread your earlier comment. With migration 10 it does do a commit, though not a close. Either an explicit commit or a close on the session does avoid the problem. Given the docs on commit I think it returns any active connections to the engine pool on a commit even with autocommit set. These connections can then get cleaned  up on engine,dispose()'}, {'account_id': 5292, 'date': '2013-03-27 01:36:19.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 4, 'date': '2013-03-27 01:36:28.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Automatically re-added by Gerrit trivial rebase detection script."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-03-27 02:13:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Works for me

Build succeeded.

[{'created': '2013-03-21 22:26:15.000000000', 'message': 'close db migration session

Explicitly close sessions in db migration 022. With the postgresql backend
if the session is not closed explicitly it leaves a user of the db behind
which can cause problems later on

Fixes bug #1158544

Change-Id: I389b83397addc5901aa94b584856fbd7f5cef485
'}, {'created': '2013-03-27 01:36:19.000000000', 'message': 'close db migration session

Explicitly close sessions in db migration 022. With the postgresql backend
if the session is not closed explicitly it leaves a user of the db behind
which can cause problems later on

Fixes bug #1158544

Change-Id: I389b83397addc5901aa94b584856fbd7f5cef485
'}]
commit_message:
close db migration session

Explicitly close sessions in db migration 022. With the postgresql backend
if the session is not closed explicitly it leaves a user of the db behind
which can cause problems later on

Fixes bug #1158544

Change-Id: I389b83397addc5901aa94b584856fbd7f5cef485

commit_message:
baremetal: VirtualPowerDriver uses mac addresses in bm_interfaces

After the change I6653829364b0a641442d45e766493180d6f2a880,
bm_nodes.prov_mac_address is no longer set. However VPD still
uses it. This patch changes VPD to use bm_interfaces.address
instead of bm_nodes.prov_mac_address.

Fixes bug 1168574.

Change-Id: I2bab869b282958ee9fd0e4776928e56351018324
(cherry picked from commit 708ff76a993e48e17025c5c2d5451e2e49adc696)

commit_message:
Get rid of create state in Instance

We don't want to store any state in the Instance object, instead take
advantage of the new mechanism whereby the result of handle_create() is
passed to check_active().

This makes the autoscaling code uglier for now (since it must still store
the instance state in the instance), but this will go away when we move to
using co-routines to create resources in parallel.

Change-Id: Ib11c8da22900453eb9713eba5106859c8a09dbe2

commit_message:
Get rid of create state in Autoscaling

Avoid storing the state of instances that are currently being created in
the instance group resource itself. Instead, ensure that they are returned
from handle_create() and take advantage of that result being passed back in
to check_active().

Change-Id: Ie2c75eaee620aa0599665168bfb92b345128d392

commit_message:
Fix pyflakes-bypass for PyFlakes 0.7

Don't make assumptions about argument types, get the line number from the
message object.

Fixes bug #1171420

Change-Id: Id0b1b254a1561941dea8ab5bb23aea1f936e7f0b

commit_message:
Remove service _user, _password, _tenant from context

These are not currently used anywhere in heat-engine, and I'm
not comfortable with the service password going over the (controller)
network.

If heat-engine needs access to these in the future then they can always
be configured in heat-engine.conf, or the operation can be performed
in the api and the results put into the context.

Change-Id: I81aab6b5a2c9aa7d6412531f70108857cbfa637b

[{'created': '2013-04-08 04:29:04.000000000', 'message': 'Move heat-api auth_token conf from paste.ini

keystone auth_token middleware now allows heat to have auth_token
configuration in heat-api.conf. This commit moves the example of
auth_token configuration from heat-api-paste.ini to heat-api.conf.
This simplifies user configuations and users is no longer required
to edit heat-api-paste.ini.

This change does not break backward compatibility. auth_token first
tries the configurations in /etc/heat/heat-api-paste.ini and then the
above configurations. Thus a user who already uses heat-api-paste.ini
does not need to change it.

Change-Id: Ia0a4d912cd7380094e121ee4af733277ca4d812e

commit_message:
Move heat-api auth_token conf from paste.ini

keystone auth_token middleware now allows heat to have auth_token
configuration in heat-api.conf. Moves the example of
auth_token configuration from heat-api-paste.ini to heat-api.conf.
This simplifies user configuations and users is no longer required
to edit heat-api-paste.ini.

This does not break backward compatibility. auth_token first
tries the configurations in /etc/heat/heat-api-paste.ini and then the
above configurations. Thus a user who already uses heat-api-paste.ini
does not need to change it.

Change-Id: Ia0a4d912cd7380094e121ee4af733277ca4d812e
Blueprint: keystone-middleware

'}, {'account_id': 4328, 'date': '2013-04-08 21:31:53.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Looks good but I'm not clear if this is doing the right thing re signing_dir, a patch doing the exact same thing to glance's paste config got nack'd:

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/19380/

Although I see the nova paste config does specify signing_dir.

Also, if we do specify it, don't the directories need to be unique per service to avoid risk of each service trampling on another's signing data?

So I'm confused, would be good to clarify this before merging.

You mention devstack sets this, but we also need to make sure this still works for those of us not running devstack"}, {'account_id': 4571, 'date': '2013-04-08 23:14:12.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

As far as having a default value for signing_dir I think this is reasonable as long as install.sh relies on other defaults providing something functional.

As for having a separate signing_dir for each API, glance uses auth_token in its api and registry, and in devstack each is given a separate signing_dir.  I'll revise this change to do that."}, {'account_id': 4571, 'date': '2013-04-08 23:31:33.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-04-08 23:39:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Works for me

This replaces our old forked auth_token with a subclass
of keystoneclient middleware.

The advantages of moving to keystoneclient middleware:
- can use v3 (or v2) keystone api
- PKI tokens
- token revocation

The subclass sets the following headers to be consumed by our

PKI token authentication doesn't work.
