commit_message:
Subclass keystone middleware to set headers

Replace old forked auth_token with a subclass
of keystoneclient middleware.

The advantages of moving to keystoneclient middleware:
- can use v3 (or v2) keystone api
- PKI tokens
- token revocation

The subclass sets the following headers to be consumed by our
request context filter:
- X-Admin-User
- X-Admin-Pass
- X-Admin-Tenant-Name
- X-Auth-Url

The need to override _build_user_headers should be a short-term thing,
X-Admin-* isn't actually used currently, and there are a few options
that need to be discussed for getting X-Auth-Url to the engine.

Change-Id: Iacc5046fbf559724a4ae0bd6091d662e23d65544
Blueprint: keystone-middleware

I'm going to be a bit nitpicky here.  Overall it looks good, but since the specific purpose for this patch is to not query for vcpus when cached I would like to see a test that ensures dom.vcpus() is not called."}, {'account_id': 4468, 'date': '2013-04-23 08:36:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Abandoned

I found a issue of this patch with libvirt/kvm used, so I abandon it now. the problem is that:
1. terminate a running instance(the biggest domain id may be 5)
2. restart libvirtd
3. create a new instance during the periodic task(id may still be 5)
4. the vcpu used cache is corruption
it is because the libvirtd generated and saved the domain id list, if it is restarted, the id of a new created domain will be reset to (the biggest of current+1).'}]

commit_message:
Cache vcpu used num of domain in periodic task

blueprint cache-used-vcpu-of-domain
We saw the periodic task stopped running and blocked at getting
vcpu num of domain, and the vcpu num of domain will not be
changed util the hotplug of vcpu is supported by hypervisor,
so we needn't get it everytime in period task.
This bp is relative to bug 985489, it may be relieved but can't be
resolved eventually by this patch, so a bp is posted.

Change-Id: Id36fe5a7d40e291872dea4f9922db5a5cf82b865

'}, {'account_id': 616, 'date': '2013-03-21 07:57:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Hi John,

This is pretty exciting. But the whole "production code has different paths for functional testing vs. real deployments" thing is a bit icky. I'd really like to align efforts around a test refactoring that runs the wsgi services in the same process as the test--in part to fix fragility, increase test speed, and also to make it easier to track down failure logs when tests fail (which is currently a pain in the butt).

I'm curious to know your thoughts about such a refactoring. That said, the explosion of fragile tests is terrible and I might be willing to accept some bad habits to make tests more deterministic.'}, {'account_id': 6493, 'date': '2013-03-21 15:23:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

I completely understand that concern and I expected some push back there.  First off I definitely would like to discuss the refactor you mentioned further, perhaps it would be a good topic for a design session at the upcoming summit?

I find it reasonable, and not unheard of, to have hooks for testing and debugging, provided they are small deviations (for example https://github.com/openstack/glance/blob/master/glance/common/wsgi.py#L268).  Would it be better if it was enabled/disabled with a configuration option?

Another options would be to close the socket immediately before executing the servers, or perhaps even immediately after (the servers try to get the port a few times).  This would be less deterministic but it may minimize the failures.'}, {'account_id': 616, 'date': '2013-03-22 20:01:29.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: No score

Well, fragile tests really suck, and the deviation for tests here seems pretty minimal, so I'm cool with it."}, {'account_id': 6159, 'date': '2013-03-25 10:35:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

I agree that we should refactor current tests! An idea could be (dunno if it is what you guys had in mind) to reduce the number of tests requiring an up & running server in favor of direct wsgi calls.

Thoughts?'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-04-09 06:03:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Abandoned

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-03-20 02:03:49.000000000', 'message': 'Eliminate the race when selecting an available port in functional tests

Functional tests currently select ports on which the various services
will listen by opening a socket in the ephemeral port range, checking
its port, closing the socket, and then sometime later starting the
service and instructing it to use that port.  There are a few bugs
that reference fragile tests.  In many of these case it is possible that
another processes claimed the selected port in between the time it
was first opened and closed and the time that the service actually used
it.  Because this is a known possibility, and because the tests fail
infrequently resolving these bug becomes difficult.

This patch eliminates the window in which another processes could
claim the port.  The socket is opened in the test code but not closed.
Then the service process (api or registry) is forked off where it
inherits the open file descriptor.  A environment variable is used
to tell the new wsgi process that it is a test process and should thus
get its socket from the FD instead of creating a new socket.

In the case where glance-control is used with the --respawn option this
solution is not possible.  The problem is that the FD is only good
once.  I can pass from the test code, to glance-control, and to
glance-{api, registry} but only 1 time.  If the service dies, and
glance-control restarts it the FD will no longer be valid.  For this
case the forked FD code is disabled.  However, the socket is still
closed much later making the race condition even less likely.

This fixes bug: 1047593
It may fix some other "fragile test" bugs as well.

Change-Id: I27313d144bc7bd2132a604dcc22916c80338abab

commit_message:
Eliminate the race when selecting a port for tests.

Functional tests currently select ports on which the various services
will listen by opening a socket in the ephemeral port range, checking
its port, closing the socket, and then sometime later starting the
service and instructing it to use that port.  There are a few bugs that
reference fragile tests.  In many of these case it is possible that
another processes claimed the selected port in between the time it was
first opened and closed and the time that the service actually used it.
Because this is a known possibility, and because the tests fail
infrequently resolving these bug becomes difficult.

This patch eliminates the window in which another processes could claim
the port.  The socket is opened in the test code but not closed. Then
the service process (api or registry) is forked off where it inherits
the open file descriptor.  A environment variable is used to tell the
new wsgi process that it is a test process and should thus get its
socket from the FD instead of creating a new socket.

In the case where glance-control is used with the --respawn option this
solution is not possible.  The problem is that the FD is only good once.
I can pass from the test code, to glance-control, and to glance-{api,
registry} but only 1 time.  If the service dies, and glance-control
restarts it the FD will no longer be valid.  For this case the forked FD
code is disabled.  However, the socket is still closed much later making
the race condition even less likely.

This fixes bug: 1047593
It may fix some other "fragile test" bugs as well.

Change-Id: I27313d144bc7bd2132a604dcc22916c80338abab

commit_message:
Add a policy handler to control copy-from functionality

This patch adds the ability to set a policy handler to control what
users can use the 'copy_from' feature in the v1 API.

Fixes bug: 1153614

Change-Id: Ie194979a2aa66c9327bf14d7a85ead6f773a6079

commit_message:
Shares Service in Cinder.

Introduces the new 'Shares' service inside Cinder. Special care
has been taken to have a minimum overlap with the existing code,
and to not modify the existing methods much.

The new shares service allows creation/deletion of shares
(NFS and CIFS) and provides allowing/denying access for a share to
a particular IP. Creating snapshots of shares, and creating a share
from a snapshot is also supported. Drivers for Linux LVM and
NetApp 7-mode storage controller are provided. Drivers for other
vendors can be added easily based on the provided framework.

Change-Id: Ifea0e7fd16e8a36b41898e761175496bd36154c5

commit_message:
Move yes/no strings to constants

Instead of having function level (and repeated) constants
for boolean values, just have a single set of contants for
these values, and share them in the various functions.

Change-Id: I6af013e849e1c6cf1bfd944a8f81dbd46abac70d

commit_message:
The newer subunit spews into the output stream.

This causes all sorts of chaos with your terminal when this
happens, so until further notice pin subunit until this is
resolved.

Example of spewing @ http://paste.openstack.org/show/35734/

Change-Id: I76b4f54de113539c9b0cecab37ccbab1ce5a4bff

Needs rebasing and conflict resolution.

The .get(xxxxx, None) are redundant; get already has a default of None.

Bare excepts are not good without documentation as to exactly why they have to be that way. At worst, except Exception or except (Exception, Timeout) should be used.

The get_trans_id refactor should also modify catch_errors middleware and should probably end up in swift.common.

The xxxxx_info refactors that now momentarily reset the self.app.xxxxx_autocreate settings seems very hacky. Why doesn't get_info just take an autocreate argument?

All the test changes worry me for a refactor. Admittedly I haven't run all the tests since this needs rebasing, but normally you'd want very few test changes with a refactor to have higher confidence nothing was broken. For example, can you explain the status code changes, such as the 404s to 504s?"}, {'account_id': 4108, 'date': '2013-04-22 22:18:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

$gholt

Will resubmit under a new patch name after 1. rebasing 2. removing redundent .get(xxxxx, None) 3. avoiding bare exceptions 4. keeping trans_id the way it is today - I realized I no longer need to touch that code for this patch 5. keeping the hacky setting of the self.app.xxxxx_autocreate - this will be removed in follow up patches anyhow as the deprecated code will step by step disappear. 6. I found all test changes needed - I will try to add more documentation where applicable.'}, {'account_id': 4108, 'date': '2013-04-23 05:34:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Abandoned

In view of massive merging effort was redone as (Take 2) and will be sent as a separate patch.'}]

Ian, thanks for breaking these back up, but they are still dependent on each other.  I'm guessing these are in the same branch so git-review creates the dependent reviews.  This makes it hard to review and merge the simple things until everything in front of them is merged.  For changes that really do not depend on each other if you can commit them from different branches they will not be marked as dependant in Gerrit."}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2013-04-18 23:44:17.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 6473, 'date': '2013-04-18 23:44:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

Automatically re-added by Gerrit trivial rebase detection script.'}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2013-04-19 00:10:19.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> Ian, thanks for breaking these back up, but they are still dependent on each other. 
> This makes it hard to review and merge the simple things until everything in front of them is merged

Each of the patches are necessary but not sufficient on their own for RHEL6 support.  If you would like to deal with them piecemeal that's fine; any individual patch will not disrupt anything else.

I've removed the dependencies and rebased them to TOT which hopefully helps you out reviewing them."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-04-19 00:29:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Works for me

commit_message:
Rename Qpid package for RHEL6

Qpid package name is different in RHEL6 to Fedora.  Also a small
re-write of the config file is required to avoid authenication issues.

Change-Id: I29435ddaaf73ad0e060d2ee9a77a2f6d2e23bfdd

[{'created': '2013-04-09 13:13:24.000000000', 'message': "Enable debug logging in q-agt output

when only q-agt is used, without q-svc, typically in a multi-host config, q-agt wasn't logging debug output.
This change enable debug output, as it's done for q-l3, q-dhcp or q-meta agent.

Change-Id: I1f49cf9994fa9cfbaa166dac8d4e713ba99c5674
Fixes: bug #1166775
"}]
commit_message:
Enable debug logging in q-agt output

when only q-agt is used, without q-svc, typically in a multi-host config, q-agt wasn't logging debug output.
This change enable debug output, as it's done for q-l3, q-dhcp or q-meta agent.

Change-Id: I1f49cf9994fa9cfbaa166dac8d4e713ba99c5674
Fixes: bug #1166775

ayoung: I believe you wrote this code... if you switch branches to one with a different migration history / different number of migrations, won't you be testing against the wrong "pristine" database after this change?'}, {'account_id': 2218, 'date': '2013-04-05 13:16:19.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Ah, yes.  I tend to run git clean -xdf tests so I don't see this problem, but others would.  We need to do a single cleanup at the end of the entire run."}, {'account_id': 4, 'date': '2013-04-05 16:28:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

rm pristine in run_tests.sh then?'}, {'account_id': 2218, 'date': '2013-04-05 16:36:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

That will only work for developers, but not for Tox, which is what Jenkins runs.'}, {'account_id': 4, 'date': '2013-04-05 18:27:25.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

commit_message:
don't migrate as often

saves a bunch of time in the tests (the savings are more noticable
if you are not running the integration tests)

before:

Slowest 5 tests took 5.80 secs:
    1.53    TokenExpirationTest.test_maintain_uuid_token_expiration
    1.22    TestTokenRevoking.test_deleting_group_grant_revokes_tokens
    1.08    TestTokenRevoking.test_group_membership_changes_revokes_token
    1.06    IdentityTestCase.test_crud_group_domain_role_grants
    0.92    CatalogTestCase.test_create_endpoint_on_v2
----------------------------------------------------------------------
Ran 1274 tests in 149.136s

OK (SKIP=84)

after:

Slowest 5 tests took 4.82 secs:
    1.53    TokenExpirationTest.test_maintain_uuid_token_expiration
    0.90    TestTokenRevoking.test_deleting_group_grant_revokes_tokens
    0.84    TestTokenRevoking.test_group_membership_changes_revokes_token
    0.78    Kc11TestCase.test_token_expiry_maintained
    0.77    TestTokenRevoking.test_deleting_user_grant_revokes_token
----------------------------------------------------------------------
Ran 1274 tests in 102.986s

OK (SKIP=84)

Change-Id: I1f39ad0412e739a333e4b755ca00a94ccbf400be

commit_message:
test duplicate name

the test_list_trust_by_trustee method in test_backend is
duplicated. One of them should be test_list_trust_by_trustor.

The original test_list_trust_by_trustee that wasn't run before
had a couple of problems so fixed those, too.

Change-Id: I14759c83c5d4b7387e5d760d8418b889c4522c21

Fix hyperv copy file error logged incorrect

This patch just fix hyperv copy file error message
incorrect, missing src and dest value.

Fixes bug #1170580

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-04-18 09:20:13.000000000', 'message': "Can now reboot rescued instances in xenapi

This patch makes it possible to reboot an instance that is rescue mode.

It causes the reboot action to search first for rescue mode VM (the
normal VMs name plus '-rescue') .. if it can't find it, it does a reboot
of the normal VM. If it finds the rescue one first, it'll reboot the
rescue instance.

If there are more than one VM with 'name-rescue', it'll raise an
exception just like it did if there were more than one VM named 'name'.

Helps with bug 1170237

Change-Id: I1858d86bf93546618eeaaec92d856f5236f3f090

commit_message:
Can now reboot rescued instances in xenapi

This patch makes it possible to reboot an instance that is in rescue mode.

It causes the reboot action to search first for rescue mode VM (the
normal VMs name plus '-rescue') .. if it can't find it, it does a reboot
of the normal VM. If it finds the rescue one first, it'll reboot the
rescue instance.

If there is more than one VM named 'myvm-rescue', it'll raise an
exception just like it did if there were more than one VM named 'myvm'.

Helps with bug: 1170237

Change-Id: I1858d86bf93546618eeaaec92d856f5236f3f090

subject: Allows xenapi 'lookup' to look for rescue mode VMs

When you lookup a VM by name, you can specify if you want it to check if

If it finds the rescue mode instance, it'll return that one instead
of the original name.

This is useful for operations that should work on the rescue mode vm if
it's there, or the normal one, if it's not.

commit_message:
Allows xenapi 'lookup' to look for rescue mode VMs

When you lookup a VM by name, you can specify if you want it to check if
it has a rescue mode instance running.

If it finds the rescue mode instance, it'll return that one instead
of the original name.

This is useful for operations that should work on the rescue mode vm if
it's there, or the normal one, if it's not.

Work towards bug: 1170237
Change-Id: I41b31e59631b78a62faadb9970b6b824929e7061

Does this patch actually reboot the rescued instance?"}, {'account_id': 4419, 'date': '2013-04-20 06:59:49.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

Hi Yum,

This patch itself doesn't do it, it is the first in a series patchs designed to work together. The last patch in the series enables the reboot to happen.

 + Ie442bcc8	Stop vm_state reset on reboot of rescued vm

 + I140f091b	Adds tests to xenapi.vm_utils's 'lookup' method

 + I41b31e59	Allows xenapi 'lookup' to look for rescue mode VMs

 + I1858d86b	Can now reboot rescued instances in xenapi"}, {'account_id': 4419, 'date': '2013-04-20 07:04:21.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

The last patch doesn't seem to be linking very well, so I'll manually add it here.

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/27107/

The actual reboot fix is only for the xenapi driver. As far as I know it already works in other drivers, but I haven't actually tested it. I guess if it doesn't work in other drivers, people will file bugs.

However if these patches go through, even if it doesn't actually perform a reboot in other drivers, at least it won't just set it to ACTIVE."}, {'account_id': 1711, 'date': '2013-04-20 16:07:11.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

OK. Fair enough. Usually a series of related patches are sent in together with dependency for review. So I didn't see the other related ones. But I guess there is no need to be pedantic to enforce that."}, {'account_id': 5638, 'date': '2013-04-20 17:47:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

commit_message:
Stop vm_state reset on reboot of rescued vm

When a VM is in rescue mode, giving it a reboot will reset its state in
the DB back to ACTIVE.

This patch stops that happening.

Work towards bug: 1170237
Change-Id: Ie442bcc85ed7ad5d897b88ffd0dbcf6eeee7b990

commit_message:
Improve Python 3.x compatibility

Mechanical translation of the deprecated except x,y:
construct. the except x as y: construct works with
all python 2.6+ versions

commit_message:
Adds support for post-install scripts.

Post install scripts are useful because they can perform tasks you want
to handle after the OS/application install but before the first boot
of the image. e.g: Clean the cache left by the package manager reducing
the size of the image.

Change-Id: I03e77f602192bbdce29c02999d1b57fac8051ddc
Fixes: Bug #1145786

Change default passwords in boot-stack to 'unset'.

This is intended to make it more obvious that default
passwords are in use.

While `setup.py`s were being installed from the openstack
pypi mirror, `pip-requires` were coming from pypi.python.org,
which has been observed to be less stable.

This change installs all pip-requires via pypi.openstack.org.

Change-Id: Id78110232f1f6cbce63fbe02c63f30c0e1953212
'}]
commit_message:
Install pip requirements from pypi.openstack.org.

While `setup.py`s were being installed from the openstack
pypi mirror, `pip-requires` were coming from pypi.python.org,
which has been observed to be less stable.

This change installs all pip-requires via pypi.openstack.org.

Change-Id: Id78110232f1f6cbce63fbe02c63f30c0e1953212

commit_message:
Use nova from the tripleo fork.

The tripleo nova fork contains two important patches,
(noted in source comments), which are currently awaiting merge upstream.

The nova element should switch back to using trunk nova once these
changes have landed.

This change required removing a silent translation of
`s/github.com/review.openstack.org/'.

Change-Id: Ia317823eee09afad2570f2b5678b35a018fe88f8

to test_get_method_undefined_controller_action instead, otherwise
it gets overwritten later and not run. Increases test coverage

Change-Id: I64b62560d6db9f6378df8fbc21bd9fada5088b89

commit_message:
Rename duplicate test method

test_get_method_unknown_controller_action was defined twice,
checking however for different things. Rename the 2nd instance
to test_get_method_undefined_controller_action instead, otherwise
it gets overwritten later and not run. Increases test coverage

Change-Id: I64b62560d6db9f6378df8fbc21bd9fada5088b89

* Refactor _poll_volume_usage to be more readable

* Test that detaching a volume updates the totals on the volume usage

  works.

Change-Id: I82da44137bc65d5f04bca0820eb327438d6e1f35

commit_message:
Cleanup and test volume usage on volume detach

* Refactor _poll_volume_usage to be more readable

* Test that detaching a volume updates the totals on the volume usage
  cache correctly. This works but adding test to make sure that it always
  works.

Change-Id: I82da44137bc65d5f04bca0820eb327438d6e1f35

commit_message:
Fix functional test 'test_scrubber_with_metadata_enc'

This test fails if a real swift system is specified in a config file
and passed to the tests via the GLANCE_TEST_SWIFT_CONF environment
variable. The fix is to allow location schemes of the form
'swift+http' as well as 'swift+https'.

Fixes bug 1158805

Change-Id: I9fd3a9c02b31acc2a8313acd3b88124a17d0adfb

commit_message:
Verify SSL certificates at boot time

When Glance is configured to run with SSL this patch will check
that the certificate and key exist, are readable, and match each
other at boot time.  If any of the above conditions fail an friendly
error message is logged directing the operator at a solution.
Previously the keys were not checked until a client connected.

fixes bug: 1160529

Change-Id: I16975608f9ae40ac5b84b3caa52ed5f8e22f296e

commit_message:
Add unit tests for glance.api.cached_images module

Add positive unit tests for methods:
* get_chached_images
* delete_cached_images
* get_queued_images
* queue_image
* delete_queued_image

Fixes: bug #1155188
Change-Id: I3fa6dc28a72e8c6e8402911931fb37e18cba7ea0

commit_message:
Fix Qpid test cases

The Qpid notification test cases do not currently pass.
By default they are skipped because qpid is not part of
test-requires, so it isn't automatically installed.  This fix
updates the test cases to work correctly, but does not add
qpid to test-requires because I'm unsure what impacts that
might have on other platforms.

This is part of the fix for bug 1164681

Change-Id: I40757b5de99559b4ff090e0d249f8624c2e2be10

commit_message:
Fix the deletion of a pending_delete image.

Return '403 - Forbidden' when trying to delete
a 'pending_delete' image, and does not change
its status.

Change-Id: Id5b8b31c19d0f9da8aba66b06d1b966e9c33a363
Fixes: bug #1163020

[{'created': '2013-04-22 13:37:00.000000000', 'message': 'Revert common logging use in rootwrap

Revert recent plug of common logging into rootwrap, as it breaks
rootwrap logging. Rootwrap does not make use of oslo logging and oslo
config in order to reduce the surface of code run as root.

See https://review.openstack.org/#/c/26468/ for discussion.

Change-Id: I276ade164a902d091f9aafab79bbd4cc189588eb
'}]
commit_message:
Revert common logging use in rootwrap

Revert recent plug of common logging into rootwrap, as it breaks
rootwrap logging. Rootwrap does not make use of oslo logging and oslo
config in order to reduce the surface of code run as root.

See https://review.openstack.org/#/c/26468/ for discussion.

Change-Id: I276ade164a902d091f9aafab79bbd4cc189588eb

subject: Pin python-subunit to <0.0.11
messages:
[{'account_id': 6172, 'date': '2013-04-15 18:05:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-04-15 18:11:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Works for me

Build succeeded.

- http://logs.openstack.org/26962/1/check/gate-requirements-install/12 : SUCCESS
'}, {'account_id': 4190, 'date': '2013-04-15 21:06:47.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

I think you have subunit 0.10 in your external environment, and testr is being run from there. That would explain the issue you are experiencing."}, {'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2013-04-15 21:35:11.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

You're correct that I had 0.0.10 installed, but even after upgrading that I see the same behavior.  I also double-checked that it's not installed through apt so there shouldn't be any conflict.

bnemec@openstack:/opt/stack/nova$ pip search python-subunit
python-subunit            - Python implementation of subunit test streaming protocol
  INSTALLED: 0.0.11 (latest)
bnemec@openstack:/opt/stack/nova$ tools/with_venv.sh pip search python-subunit
python-subunit            - Python implementation of subunit test streaming protocol
  INSTALLED: 0.0.11 (latest)

Also, when I ran without a venv before the upgrade it worked fine using 0.0.10.  That is now broken as well with 0.0.11 installed."}, {'account_id': 2835, 'date': '2013-04-20 16:40:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

'}, {'account_id': 2835, 'date': '2013-04-20 16:40:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Confirmed:

http://paste.openstack.org/show/36434/'}, {'account_id': 4146, 'date': '2013-04-20 19:47:47.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Do not merge

Bug 1168516 updated with details. TL;DR the problem appears to be in nova/tools/colorizer.py's consumption of subunit streams (not handling the new version of subunit). It should handle the new version of subunit making that the correct way to fix this problem."}, {'account_id': 6476, 'date': '2013-04-21 13:48:11.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

There's nothing like it, even in Experimental:

http://packages.debian.org/search?keywords=python-subunit&searchon=python-subunit&suite=all&section=all

Could this happen after Wheezy is released in early May?"}, {'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2013-04-22 14:44:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Abandoned

Will wait for a proper fix.'}, {'account_id': 4146, 'date': '2013-04-22 16:36:55.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I don't think this will affect Debian. The existing versions of subunit in Debian are fine as long as the colorizer can understand them. Currently the colorizer understands version 1 of the protocol and I expect any fix made to it to be backward compatible."}, {'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2013-04-22 16:44:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I think it would still affect Debian because it exists in pypi, and that's where the venv gets its packages: https://pypi.python.org/pypi/python-subunit/0.0.11

My Ubuntu systems don't even have the python-subunit apt package installed."}, {'account_id': 4146, 'date': '2013-04-22 16:57:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Correct, the problem of a broken colorizer affects Debian, but we do not need to wait for Wheezy to fix this as Thomas asked. This problem is independent of distro packaging. (We need to make sure we support both people using pypi and debian packages by ensuring the colorizer is subunit v1 and v2 capable).'}, {'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2013-04-22 17:28:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Ah, sorry, I misunderstood.  I agree that the change should be backward-compatible.'}, {'account_id': 6476, 'date': '2013-04-22 21:03:55.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Hi,

I think I miss-read and therefore miss understood. Indeed, since Debian has 0.0.10 of subunit, it wouldn't be a problem.

Thomas"}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-04-15 18:01:38.000000000', 'message': 'Pin python-subunit to <0.0.11

python-subunit-0.0.11 spews garbage to the console when running
testr.  Until a fix is found, pin it to an older version to
get tests working right again.

Related to https://review.openstack.org/#/c/26654

Pre-req for fix for bug 1168516

Change-Id: I24a82c4f38599f3e083b803d66ebce9388fa7d7f
'}]
commit_message:
Pin python-subunit to <0.0.11

python-subunit-0.0.11 spews garbage to the console when running
testr.  Until a fix is found, pin it to an older version to
get tests working right again.

Related to https://review.openstack.org/#/c/26654

Pre-req for fix for bug 1168516

Change-Id: I24a82c4f38599f3e083b803d66ebce9388fa7d7f

[{'created': '2013-04-22 20:32:39.000000000', 'message': 'Make Paste use default configs

Instead of specifying a custom location for the Marconi configuration file
through Paste, just use the defaults as specified by our config module.

Change-Id: Ia01e262e298f953412a36c75614c7656c3105db1
Implements: blueprint config-module
'}]
commit_message:
Make Paste use default configs

Instead of specifying a custom location for the Marconi configuration file
through Paste, just use the defaults as specified by our config module.

Change-Id: Ia01e262e298f953412a36c75614c7656c3105db1
Implements: blueprint config-module

'}, {'account_id': 2284, 'date': '2013-02-12 10:47:29.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: (1 inline comment)

Thanks for the patch Flavio,

A nitpick in-line after a first scan.

I have a couple of general questions before delving deeper.

1. I'm wondering why there's no additions to tools/{pip|test}-requires to pick up pymongo etc.

Are you relying on the conditional import here?

Is there any reason not to explicitly depend?


2. I'm wondering whether there's an implicit reliance on GirdFS running out-of-process for the tests?

If so, shouldn't we be skipping the tests if an env var like GLANCE_TEST_GRIDFS_CONF isn't set?

For an example of what I mean, see:

  https://github.com/openstack/glance/blob/master/glance/tests/functional/store/test_s3.py#L84

Cheers,
Eoghan"}, {'account_id': 6159, 'date': '2013-02-12 13:07:24.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: (1 inline comment)

Hey,

1) It wouldn't be fair to add a new dependency for an optional module, what we could actually do is print a message when users try to

2) There's actually a check for GLANCE_TEST_GRIDFS env var. :/ I may be missing your point here, tho.

Cheers"}, {'account_id': 6159, 'date': '2013-02-12 13:10:40.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-02-12 14:23:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Works for me

- http://logs.openstack.org/21431/4/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-quantum/6394 : SUCCESS
'}, {'account_id': 2284, 'date': '2013-02-12 20:51:21.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

> here's actually a check for GLANCE_TEST_GRIDFS env var. :/ I may be missing your point here, tho.

No you're not!

I obviously fat-fingered the grep through the patch file that I used to check if the skip logic was present. Should have just read the test code directly ...

I'll do a proper in-depth review shortly, leaving at -0 for now.

Cheers,
Eoghan"}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2013-02-18 17:12:59.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Do not merge

Hi Flavio - While this is definitely going to be useful to the community, I'm not willing to merge it into the core codebase this late in the cycle. It worries me to land large chunks of new code that haven't been properly tested by the community. I'd love to see a blueprint targeted at Havana-1 for this. [{'created': '2013-02-07 15:04:49.000000000', 'message': "Add GridFS store

This patch adds support for GridFS to glance. GridFS is 10gen's, mongodb
based, distributed filesystem.

The store requires 2 options in order to work correctly:
    * mongodb_store_uri
    * mongodb_store_db

Note: mongodb was used in the parameters name's even though this store
supports `gridfs://` schemas (not official) in order to keep consistency
with mongodb's documentation and connection parameters.

GridFS StoreLocations:

This store implements gridfs locations with the form `gridfs://<IMAGE>`.
Note that there's no connection information in those uris, which was
consciously omitted for security reasons. Perhaps, it could be possible
to make that information available by setting a configuration parameter
that specifies so.

commit_message:
Add GridFS store

This patch adds support for GridFS to glance. GridFS is 10gen's, mongodb
based, distributed filesystem.

The store requires 2 options in order to work correctly:
    * mongodb_store_uri
    * mongodb_store_db

Note: mongodb was used in the parameters name's even though this store
supports `gridfs://` schemas (not official) in order to keep consistency
with mongodb's documentation and connection parameters.

GridFS StoreLocations:

This store implements gridfs locations with the form `gridfs://<IMAGE>`.
Note that there's no connection information in those uris, which was
consciously omitted for security reasons. Perhaps, it could be possible
to make that information available by setting a configuration parameter
that specifies so.

Implements blueprint gridfs-store

Change-Id: I38f361ac8421f0445dd37800c840441a46cf9fdf

commit_message:
bug 1166263 image-update handling for closed stdin

handles the case where an image-update command is issued from a cron job with an
invalid standard input file descriptor: consider no image data is provided when
no --file option present.

Change-Id: I5eb3433311e5faf0a3fb7eb36f6a01e5df7efe4c

commit_message:
Stop appending default host if none is provided.

Appending the default hostname broke backward
compatibility. This change reverses that change.
Now, usernames with @ in them will need to
specify their host deliberately, but that is
a small edge case compared to every single
user call being modified without the client user's
knowing.

Fixes Bug #1171559

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-04-17 15:16:43.000000000', 'message': 'Updated the Swift installation steps for Grizzly

These changes were made following an installation of Swift and Keystone
on Ubuntu 12.04.2 using Ubuntu's Cloud Archive packages.

 * Some minor changes to "screen" blocks to introduce a space between
   "#" and the command to run.

 * Install python-keystoneclient rather than python-keystone-auth-token
   (the auth_token module moved during grizzly).

 * Install python-webob on the proxy server. It's required by
   auth_token.

 * Add instructions for creating the 'signing_dir' on the proxy server.

 * Use 'service' rather that 'swift-init' to start the various services.
   On reboot upstart will start the services anyway. Best to be
   consistent.

 * Removed instructions to create account-server.conf,
   container-server.conf and object-server.conf. These files come as
   part of the Ubuntu packages and work out of the box.

 * Moved the instructions on starting the object storage services into a
   new section following the installation of the ring files. They made
   no sense where they were as the services wouldn't start sucessfully
   until the ring files are in place.

 * Tidied up the sample proxy-server.conf.txt by removing unused
   settings and annotating the rest.

 * Added instructions to create the swift recon cache dir on each
   storage node

Change-Id: I8001849b0a492060d51f38be024b1acee569585b

commit_message:
Updated the Swift installation steps for Grizzly

These changes were made following an installation of Swift and Keystone
on Ubuntu 12.04.2 using Ubuntu's Cloud Archive packages.

 * Some minor changes to "screen" blocks to introduce a space between
   "#" and the command to run.

 * Install python-keystoneclient rather than python-keystone-auth-token
   (the auth_token module moved during grizzly).

 * Install python-webob on the proxy server. It's required by
   auth_token.

 * Add instructions for creating the 'signing_dir' on the proxy server.

 * Use 'service' rather that 'swift-init' to start the various services.
   On reboot upstart will start the services anyway. Best to be
   consistent.

 * Removed instructions to create account-server.conf,
   container-server.conf and object-server.conf. These files come as
   part of the Ubuntu packages and work out of the box.

 * Moved the instructions on starting the object storage services into a
   new section following the installation of the ring files. They made
   no sense where they were as the services wouldn't start sucessfully
   until the ring files are in place.

 * Tidied up the sample proxy-server.conf.txt by removing unused
   settings and annotating the rest.

 * Added instructions to create the swift recon cache dir on each
   storage node

Change-Id: I8001849b0a492060d51f38be024b1acee569585b

commit_message:
Make list flavor show extra specs optional.

Flavor list will get each flavors extra_specs by making fresh requests to nova.
When there are lots of flavors, the flavor list will take a while to run. So
let us make show extra-specs optional.

Fix bug: #1166455

Change-Id: I86aef1035be6a88b8d9fb49a89f5a608a72589dd

commit_message:
Use HTTP keep-alive feature in HTTPClient class

Currently  HTTPClient creates a new TCP connection for each
API request. We could actually reuse created connections by
relying upon HTTP keep-alive feature.  That would enable us
to do a few queries in a row more efficiently.

Fixes bug 1170385.

Change-Id: Ie6d8fb9670938e3790017509a242630b67abd794

commit_message:
Output of "nova --debug network-list" is not matching with the doc.

Output of "nova --debug network-list" is not matching with the doc.
The extra parameters observed are:
- rxtx_base
- priority
- dns2

Fix bug 1158645

Change-Id: Id9bb7eb762b1edfbae0d6e79451446381a5dc91e

instead of "-" (and doing so requires using "," as a separator).

Change-Id: I5e4cffaa326fbafd1583d55744f921a40b3ae76f
'}, {'created': '2013-04-09 12:56:34.000000000', 'message': 'baremetal: Change input for sfdisk

'}]
commit_message:
baremetal: Change input for sfdisk

To prevent sfdisk stopping with "bad input", use a empty string
instead of "-" (and doing so requires using "," as a separator).

Fixes bug 1166112

Change-Id: I5e4cffaa326fbafd1583d55744f921a40b3ae76f

commit_message:
Raise correct exception for duplicate networks

When using Quantum, if duplicate network ids are passed in on a
nova boot, nova-api raises a NetworkNotFound exception, which is
not correct.  This change causes it to raise a NetworkDuplicated
exception instead.

Fixes bug 1165088

Change-Id: I4f1f9aa5e1fa0e740b78e67760d924e2dd1d4d98

commit_message:
baremetal: VirtualPowerDriver uses mac addresses in bm_interfaces

After the change I6653829364b0a641442d45e766493180d6f2a880,
bm_nodes.prov_mac_address is no longer set. However VPD still
uses it. This patch changes VPD to use bm_interfaces.address
instead of bm_nodes.prov_mac_address.

Fixes bug 1168574.

Change-Id: I2bab869b282958ee9fd0e4776928e56351018324

fix E122 and E126 flake8 issues

Simple indenting for clarity. E122 and E126 are generally pretty
reasonable and not pathologic, so make these cleanups so we can
start enforcing them.

Part of violetprint:travel-day-cleanups

- http://logs.openstack.org/27256/1/check/gate-heat-pep8/2633 : SUCCESS

'}, {'account_id': 4328, 'date': '2013-04-22 12:17:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

'}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2013-04-22 12:49:04.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

This is a hack on top of a hack. Not that I'm against that kind of thing, but in this case it's not necessary ;)

The messageClass already has a lineno attribute; we should just construct the object at the beginning of the function and then read the line number from it. Had we done this originally (as suggested in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/23125/2/tools/pyflakes-bypass.py) then this wouldn't have broken across versions."}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2013-04-22 16:15:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Abandoned

Feel free :)'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-04-22 11:29:55.000000000', 'message': 'Fix pyflakes-bypass to work with pyflakes 0.7

Fixes bug #1171420

In pyflakes 0.7, the first argument to checker.report() changed from a line
number to the AST node itself.

Assume the argument is an AST node, but if AttributeError is thrown when
referencing the lineno attribute then fall back to assuming its an integer
in order to support <0.7.

Change-Id: I878616f118f83dcf88b8cc00ac8ad0e8e5c665b2
'}]
commit_message:
Fix pyflakes-bypass to work with pyflakes 0.7

Fixes bug #1171420

In pyflakes 0.7, the first argument to checker.report() changed from a line
number to the AST node itself.

Assume the argument is an AST node, but if AttributeError is thrown when
referencing the lineno attribute then fall back to assuming its an integer
in order to support <0.7.

Change-Id: I878616f118f83dcf88b8cc00ac8ad0e8e5c665b2

commit_message:
attempt to get to flake8/hacking plugins

this is the infrastructure changes, plus 1 fix, to get us towards
flake8 and hacking plugins.

We need to remove an exit call in __init__ for config to get this
to pass. I think long term this gets addressed by config becoming
a test resource, but it will take some time at summit to figure
that out.

Change-Id: Iedd7931e85da5518cb2a8d58717e37b805267d2c

commit_message:
Fix test redifinitions

A few testcases had duplicate names, which caused
the original test to be redefined and not executed
anymore. Also one case was apparently entirely duplicate.
Raises unit test coverage by two tests.

Change-Id: Ibf3db93b7fee875877c1bac8797eb88fc9a99874

commit_message:
Use print_function __future__ import

Rather than continuing to use the old print statement, use the actual
print function introduced in python 2.6. See:

  http://docs.python.org/2/whatsnew/2.6.html#pep-3105-print-as-a-function

Change-Id: I059d982d60e13f13e1caf49509c0fe0b18eda723

Would rootwrap have problems using common log?'}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2013-04-22 13:24:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Adding Thierry because I think he may have explicitly avoided using the common logging stuff to reduce the attack vector on rootwrap

Also, AFAICT this will fail because rootwrap does not initialize cfg.CONF

Thierry - feel free to propose a revert if it did break rootwrap'}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2013-04-22 13:30:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Yes, that breaks logging in rootwrap, which is not enabled by default. Will propose a revert.

I stayed out of using oslo.config and oslo.log in rootwrap to reduce the surface of code run as root.'}, {'account_id': 1994, 'date': '2013-04-22 13:34:06.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Understood. I'll submit a new patch discarding changes to rootwrap"}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2013-04-22 13:34:59.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

I'm on it"}, {'account_id': 1994, 'date': '2013-04-22 13:37:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Oh I thought the patch itself will get reverted. Got it.'}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2013-04-22 13:38:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

See https://review.openstack.org/#/c/27259'}]

commit_message:
Replaces standard logging with common logging

Common modules can now safely import other common modules
since update.py will automatically install dependencies.

Change-Id: I0ad12d7e6e623657c40659aca4148439cd03d3fa

So, I agree with Davanum Srinivas that setting the socket up in __init__ is probably not ideal, but I don't believe there is another place for it that would not require API changes to the `service.Service` class, and all of it's descendants."}, {'account_id': 741, 'date': '2013-03-18 12:10:09.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

Well.. Actually, We could probably make use of the lockutils.synchronized decorator to keep things in the start method.. I'll prepare another patch for review using that method."}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-03-26 06:03:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Abandoned

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-03-26 06:03:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 741, 'date': '2013-03-29 23:24:42.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

> Well.. Actually, We could probably make use of the lockutils.synchronized decorator to keep things in the start method.. I'll prepare another patch for review using that method.

I'm not convinced I was thinking straight as I said this :)

It's also worth noting, nova currents sets up socket during the service's `__init__()` method, similar to this patch."}, {'account_id': 741, 'date': '2013-03-29 23:24:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Restored'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-04-06 06:03:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

thanks Mark for the poke, yes, i am good with Kiall's explanation."}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2013-04-22 13:09:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Looks good to me (core reviewer); Approved

Sorry it took so long to get around to reviewing this. Thanks for the patch

Indeed you're right that Nova binds the socket in __init__ - https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/6e5c59b/nova/wsgi.py#L120

So, the fix looks good to me ... it would have been nice to include a test showing this fixing wsgi.Service with ProcessLauncher though

I needed to remind myself how child processes sharing the same bound socket works - for reference, 27.6 "TCP Preforked Server, No Locking around accept" describes what we're doing here'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-04-22 13:09:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: No score

commit_message:
Move wsgi.Service socket creation into the constructor.

This allows wsgi.Service to be used with service.ProcessLauncher

Fixes Bug #1156182

Change-Id: I71714d243c8a1b90c7bc1006ca2ad1e8c4b30e57

commit_message:
Tenants support implemented for clusters.

Clusters are now tenant-specific.
NodeTemplates are accessible from any tenant.

Change-Id: Idca961b813bf3ff62dd6f9d722b6524d0b79f2c2
Fixes: bug #1171207

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-04-22 11:29:11.000000000', 'message': "Simplify rpc client calls

We always pass host=None to _engine_topic() which means that we always
construct a topic using CONF.engine_topic and CONF.host.

And since RpcProxy methods falls back to the topic supplied to its
constructor, we never need to explicitly pass it.

We can safely remove the _engine_topic() method and the passing of an
explicit topic to RpcProxy methods and replace it with constructing the
correct topic at construction time, without causing any functional
changes.

While we're at it, replace the last use of the variable name FLAGS with
CONF.

Change-Id: Iefdc6b78a068975ac45b10d6b53210cb283d2ef8
"}]
commit_message:
Simplify rpc client calls

We always pass host=None to _engine_topic() which means that we always
construct a topic using CONF.engine_topic and CONF.host.

And since RpcProxy methods falls back to the topic supplied to its
constructor, we never need to explicitly pass it.

We can safely remove the _engine_topic() method and the passing of an
explicit topic to RpcProxy methods and replace it with constructing the
correct topic at construction time, without causing any functional
changes.

While we're at it, replace the last use of the variable name FLAGS with
CONF.

Change-Id: Iefdc6b78a068975ac45b10d6b53210cb283d2ef8

commit_message:
Fix warnings in storage/server.pp.

Updates the swift storage/server class so that we quote $pipeline
before doing a comparison check for the server type. This fixes
an issue where warnings would always get printed when using the
default $pipeline variable.

Fixes LP Bug #1171052.

Change-Id: I3076b6110f1a42c0e6c179d18952b0b013908f01

commit_message:
Expose "protected" attribute of images.

Adds support for displaying and setting the protected
attribute on images.  If images are protected, delete
actions are not enabled

Fixes bug 1168067

Change-Id: Iedf4fa8840c713333679762ac4fc06fd0cf1a322

commit_message:
Add PostgreSQL and MySQL modules to venv

Will now require the my-sql devel packages installed to build a venv
Adding these modules will enable running the unit tests aginst backends other than sqlite.

Change-Id: I0c6bb641b9b7a98dc699de2d04f467e18d74384c

commit_message:
Returns 501 instead of 404 for agent's non-implemented action

Part of bug fix 1146586

Modify 'Controller._populate_tenant_id' won't add 'tenant_id' field
if attribution info of resource didn't include it.

Because agent's attribution info didn't include 'tenant_id',
that cause BadRequest error when invoke 'Controller._verify_attributes'
after 'Controller._populate_tenant_id' added 'tenant_id' to request params
from request context.

Change-Id: If18218e6d611011c62fd19a639c386cd672767a2

I did some testing here and a small side effect occurs with this patch.  If location and copy_from are both used, copy_from is not removed from the fields and this it ends up as a property on the image, ex: 

$ glance show <ID>
.....
Property 'copy_from': http://berrange.fedorapeople.org/images/2012-02-29/f16-x86_64-openstack-sda.qcow2

without this patch this does not occur.  This should probably be a separate bug.  

However I would like to see some test added with this bug fix if possible."}, {'account_id': 6493, 'date': '2013-04-12 21:03:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

I added a test for it here:

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-04-11 12:48:24.000000000', 'message': 'Fix "glance add" parsing of "copy_from" option.

copy_from was ignored which resulted in "glance add" attempting to read from
stdout.

Fixes bug 1167899

Change-Id: I57fd85f7bb655bef69222d4fdf6b8274088ca827
'}]
commit_message:
Fix "glance add" parsing of "copy_from" option.

copy_from was ignored which resulted in "glance add" attempting to read from
stdout.

Fixes bug 1167899

Change-Id: I57fd85f7bb655bef69222d4fdf6b8274088ca827

commit_message:
Update image size limit for the new variable name.

Now that diskimage-builder has migrated IMAGE_SIZE to DIB_IMAGE_SIZE we
need the same thing here.

commit_message:
Fix Ubuntu image fetching.

Set a bash option which has been breaking cold builds due to an extended
glob pattern.

Change-Id: Ideab0fca057eb3744002ae137ac1f988b61bb560

Nothing against this review per se, but after reading this blog:

http://doughellmann.com/2012/11/the-performance-impact-of-using-dict-instead-of-in-cpython-2-7-2.html

using dict() instead of {} suddenly does not sound like a great idea to me. I am adding Doug to the review so that he could chime in."}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2013-04-21 18:52:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: (1 inline comment)

I am not sure that performance is a consideration here - this is specifically for logging. Build succeeded.

- http://logs.openstack.org/27059/5/check/gate-quantum-pep8/6395 : SUCCESS
- http://docs-draft.openstack.org/27059/5/check/gate-quantum-docs/5629/doc/build/html/ : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/27059/5/check/gate-quantum-python26/6004 : SUCCESS

- http://logs.openstack.org/27059/5/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-quantum/18729 : SUCCESS
'}, {'account_id': 261, 'date': '2013-04-21 18:52:07.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

Gary - I did not realize you pushed another change in the meanwhile!
I recall the email thread, but I think no final decision was really taken.

I am ok with removing locals and replace with a dictionary. there was a discussion between dict(...) and {...}. since we're doing I/O anyway this is probably a very minor minor point.

The only thing I'd like to mention is that HACKING currently states we need to use keyword parameters but I do not recall anything stating explicitly that a purpose-built dictionary should be used instead of locals for populating these parameters."}, {'account_id': 748, 'date': '2013-04-21 18:52:07.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

Fair enough; my concern was that the use of dict() might set up a (bad) example even for other parts of the codebase that weren't specifically involved with I/O"}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2013-04-21 18:52:07.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-04-21 18:52:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Works for me

Build succeeded.

- http://logs.openstack.org/27059/6/check/gate-quantum-pep8/6399 : SUCCESS
- http://docs-draft.openstack.org/27059/6/check/gate-quantum-docs/5633/doc/build/html/ : SUCCESS

- http://logs.openstack.org/27059/6/check/gate-quantum-python26-rhel6/323 : SUCCESS (non-voting)

- http://logs.openstack.org/27059/6/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-quantum/18746 : SUCCESS
'}, {'account_id': 704, 'date': '2013-04-21 18:52:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

'}, {'account_id': 748, 'date': '2013-04-21 18:52:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

gary: I am easy either way. Most likely {} is favored over dict(), so in practice the style problem is remote; as for performance, IMO most of the things that happen in Quantum are IO bound,  so we really do not have a problem there either.

Coding style wise, we could always use Hacking rules to flag up (with a warning) the use of dict() if it does not appear in the surroundings of a LOG statement, hence my lgtm.'}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2013-04-21 18:52:07.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

Regarding the dict vs the {}. I am easy to do either or. If the consensus is for {} then I'll do it.
I was just under the impression that dict was more readable."}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2013-04-21 18:52:07.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2013-04-21 18:52:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

I agree with you. We should try and enforce this via tox. I wanted to prepare the code so that we could automate.

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-04-21 18:52:04.000000000', 'message': "Fix a comment formatting to make pep8 test pass

New version of pyflakes does checking of doctests. We have a
comment that looks like a doctest, but in fact it's not. This
makes pep8 test fail.

Fixes bug 1170639.

Change-Id: Iee4f1bb8fd8284c6d1bb0111e23a61f434f3f457
"}]
commit_message:
Fix a comment formatting to make pep8 test pass

New version of pyflakes does checking of doctests. We have a
comment that looks like a doctest, but in fact it's not. This
makes pep8 test fail.

Fixes bug 1170639.

Change-Id: Iee4f1bb8fd8284c6d1bb0111e23a61f434f3f457

commit_message:
Add gettext install.

When we pulled this from nova, the gettext.install went away, but it
turns out that it's super important, otherwise the import test gets
messed up by _ and our assumption that it gets imported from the
execution entrypoints in bin/ and the test runner.

Change-Id: I7e51d93c44af9f08d7177097c3992127d5851ce0
Reviewed-on: https://review.openstack.org/26970
Reviewed-by: Joe Gordon <jogo@cloudscaling.com>
Approved: Monty Taylor <mordred@inaugust.com>
Tested-by: Jenkins

commit_message:
Don't require flat_inferface.

The nova default for flat_interface is None but our puppet modules
currently require it to be set. This patch updates the flatdhcp
module so that it defaults to undef thus making it possible to use
nova::network w/ flatdhcp when no flat_interface(private_interface) is
defined.

Fixes LP Bug #1170569.

Change-Id: I62b91d9aef652c9d6b0a9e344832f6bef2bc3f27

[{'created': '2013-04-19 05:05:51.000000000', 'message': 'Remove Flags usage from cinder.volume.driver

cinder.volume.driver was using a mix of FLAGS and the
new conf options for multi-backend.  The result was failure
of multi-backend configrations to set the iscsi_helper
option.

This updates the driver.py file to use the OSLO.cfg and fixes the
check for iscsi_helper check in the initialize_connection call,
which was undefined.

Fixes bug: 1169928

Change-Id: Ia1678893f32a9d08a695f055f59f7296e17d9d78
'}]
commit_message:
Remove Flags usage from cinder.volume.driver

cinder.volume.driver was using a mix of FLAGS and the
new conf options for multi-backend.  The result was failure
of multi-backend configrations to set the iscsi_helper
option.

This updates the driver.py file to use the OSLO.cfg and fixes the
check for iscsi_helper check in the initialize_connection call,
which was undefined.

Fixes bug: 1169928

Change-Id: Ia1678893f32a9d08a695f055f59f7296e17d9d78

commit_message:
Sync rpc from oslo-incubator.

This includes rpc api namespace support, some minor configuration
related fixes, and the redis based matchmaker for use with impl_zmq.

Change-Id: I9fc826a498461417afe8b2a923edac8d68c2c18f

commit_message:
Fedora element installs redhat-lsb-core, not redhat-lsb.

redhat-lsb was pulling in over 100 unnecessary dependencies.

Change-Id: I2a006ee279096a2fc1305a7c9cc62e1b4411a235

commit_message:
Importing rootwrap infrastructure into Glance

Enable Glance execute system command and external program from the
functional code.

Implement bp:importing-rootwarp

Change-Id: I9786200fa6fbbefbd70d82d16e4dc0e2b15a1941
Signed-off-by: Zhi Yan Liu <zhiyanl@cn.ibm.com>

can just be flipped off.

commit_message:
Allow event reporting to be turned off.

In order to reduce the amount of conductor and db traffic
at least allow the option to turn off event reporting so
that if the database overload it causes is problematic it
can just be flipped off.

DocImpact

Change-Id: I2b82db4417636ae22c8baffc5c6d6cfb6b76f30e

[{'account_id': 5292, 'date': '2013-03-21 22:09:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

With a postgresql backend we still need to do at least a session.close if session.commit is not present even with autocommit. Otherwise it leaves a user of the db behind."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-03-22 00:08:27.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Doesn't seem to work

Build failed.  For information on how to proceed, see https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GerritJenkinsGithub#Test_Failures

- http://logs.openstack.org/25055/1/check/gate-keystone-pep8/4453 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/25055/1/check/gate-keystone-docs/2836 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/25055/1/check/gate-keystone-python26/3359 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/25055/1/check/gate-keystone-python26-rhel6/13 : SUCCESS (non-voting)
- http://logs.openstack.org/25055/1/check/gate-keystone-python27/3371 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/25055/1/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-full/9945 : FAILURE
- http://logs.openstack.org/25055/1/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-postgres-full/9660 : FAILURE
- http://logs.openstack.org/25055/1/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-quantum/15403 : FAILURE
"}, {'account_id': 5707, 'date': '2013-03-22 09:51:51.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

So I added quite a few of the commit/close calls.  My rationale was two-fold:

1) I would have thought that to provide maximum recovery capability in the case of crash during migration, that commiting, wherever possible, all the changes to a table in one go was preferable.

2) To make sqlite, MySQL and Postgresql all work is a real balancing act.  If you don't do closes in certain places you either get data left behind (as other have pointed out) or the tests will fail because of lack of cross-session integrity (suspected cause is difference in pool usage by the various DB engines)

I am absolutely all for sorting this out - the current status quo (cue music) is balanced on a knife edge, sitting on egg shells.  I think the fix is bigger than this change."}, {'account_id': 4, 'date': '2013-03-22 13:28:17.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

1) completely disagree -- untangling a half-committed migration is a pain. i'd rather see transactions applied to the entire migration, and it doesn't look like sqlalchemy-migrate does that for us (i didn't research very thoroughly though).

2) agree, but i wasn't attempting to improve that here"}, {'account_id': 4, 'date': '2013-03-22 13:30:11.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-03-22 14:10:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Works for me

Build succeeded.

- http://logs.openstack.org/25055/2/check/gate-keystone-pep8/4460 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/25055/2/check/gate-keystone-docs/2844 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/25055/2/check/gate-keystone-python26/3367 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/25055/2/check/gate-keystone-python26-rhel6/17 : SUCCESS (non-voting)
- http://logs.openstack.org/25055/2/check/gate-keystone-python27/3379 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/25055/2/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-full/10047 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/25055/2/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-postgres-full/9762 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/25055/2/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-quantum/15522 : SUCCESS
'}, {'account_id': 5707, 'date': '2013-03-22 14:38:31.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

I'd be Ok with approving this - as long as we have run test_sql_upgrade this with sqlite, MySQl and Postgres?"}, {'account_id': 5292, 'date': '2013-03-24 06:18:59.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

I don't have a problem with this version of the patch that doesn't touch the actual migrations as any left over connections get closed on process exit. Henry there is some more discussion of the issues with commit/close of sessions here:

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/25065/"}, {'account_id': 1561, 'date': '2013-03-26 01:23:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

'}, {'account_id': 5707, 'date': '2013-03-26 10:51:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Dolph - I'm going to download and test this change against all the DBs for you.  However, as a prep for that, I tried the current master - and that seems to fail with MySQL with an Integrity error!!  (Running "run_tests.sh -N test_sql_upgrade", with the backend_sql_conf set for MySQL).  So will debug that first as a matter or urgency.'}, {'account_id': 6456, 'date': '2013-03-27 04:26:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

'}, {'account_id': 6486, 'date': '2013-04-04 20:42:29.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

I don't see any reason to use transactions in test code."}, {'account_id': 2218, 'date': '2013-04-12 17:45:54.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Please run against the mysql and postgresql backends and post the test results."}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-04-20 06:03:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Abandoned

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-04-20 06:03:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-04-12 17:35:25.000000000', 'message': 'Limit the checks for block device becoming available.

Instead of previously looping potentially forever for a block
device mapping to become created from the volume api, basically
blocking a greenthread until this happens we now will have a number
of attempts (defaulting to 10) that we will wait for the volume api
to create said block device mapping (or error out).

Fixes bug 1162064

Change-Id: I6ff0b42aad48df735d09f91a0a9fe98e6abcf2eb
(cherry picked from commit 24aacd2c91c73245d444a2460ded1c5c94382f5f)
'}]
commit_message:
Limit the checks for block device becoming available.

Instead of previously looping potentially forever for a block
device mapping to become created from the volume api, basically
blocking a greenthread until this happens we now will have a number
of attempts (defaulting to 10) that we will wait for the volume api
to create said block device mapping (or error out).

Fixes bug 1162064

Change-Id: I6ff0b42aad48df735d09f91a0a9fe98e6abcf2eb
(cherry picked from commit 24aacd2c91c73245d444a2460ded1c5c94382f5f)

This is clearly a backport of a new feature, so isn't suitable for the stable branch. Thanks for the patch, though'}, {'account_id': 1531, 'date': '2013-04-02 13:06:36.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

It looks like the new feature but in reality only partially. Volumes were separated from Nova in the Folsom release. After separation was not possible to obtain host for certain volume. Your rationale might have been persuasive some months ago but , at this point, stable/folsom is about to go into "security fixes only" mode so we want to be especially cautious. Also, the fact that this wasn't raised much earlier suggests it's not a big issue for many people.

Thanks for the patch, though'}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2013-04-05 12:11:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

commit_message:
Backported VolumeHostAttribute API extension

Expose the host on which a volume resides through a new API
extension. This is only presented to Admins by default. This
can be controlled with the 'volume_host_attribute' policy
rule.

Conflicts:

	etc/cinder/policy.json

Change-Id: Iee2d69ba051765b734494a9637ddd73e07db1e22

commit_message:
Backport lockutils, fileutils to Folsom.

NetApp drivers require locking mechanism to be present in
Folsom version. So this commit backports it.

This commit also includes some recent security fixes to
lockutils file, including:

3cb71ff Locking edge case when lock_path does not exist
21925b6 Fix locking issues in Windows
547ab34 Fix Copyright Headers - Rename LLC to Foundation

Fix bug 1158179

Change-Id: I477237c01420ca555806cdfc91956e297ddbc747

[{'created': '2012-12-22 18:14:17.000000000', 'message': 'Unify services and hosts API

Update requests accept wrapped entities (i.e.,
{"host":{...}} instead of {...}). All returned entities
are wrapped in the same way. This 'wrapping' behavour is
used in other parts of Nova API.

Host power actions are now POST, not GET, because they
change host state.

Also, several typos are fixed.

commit_message:
Unify services and hosts API

Update requests accept wrapped entities (i.e.,
{"host":{...}} instead of {...}). All returned entities
are wrapped in the same way. This 'wrapping' behavour is
used in other parts of Nova API.

Host power actions are now POST, not GET, because they
change host state.

DocImpact

Change-Id: If50a6b6e20f9b3fe66d486bb9b15d3eb4b62daf9

commit_message:
Removes created_at, updated_at from ModelBase

Created a 'TimestampMixin' class.
Next step is to update Nova which is the only project using oslo.db

Fixes bug #1119702

commit_message:
Replaces the standard uuid with common in the context module

Common modules can now safely import other common modules
since update.py will automatically install dependencies.

Change-Id: I9fca5959581ae4f4ab3da20caabbe9c0d53247b6

commit_message:
Fixes running horizon on fedora 18 and above

Fixes bug: 1167066
Summary:

1. Starting with fedora 18 the httpd.conf has
    <Directory />
        AllowOverride none
        Require all denied
    </Directory>
  which requires you to explicitly permit access to web content
  directories in other <Directory> blocks

2. Install nodejs on fedora 18 and above

Change-Id: I487a7a74bad6627d32c1081dcbe48630a704a106

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-04-19 09:45:11.000000000', 'message': 'Extra safety on account-level DELETE

I just noticed tonight when adding a bunch of stuff to Swiftly that
the Bulk Delete middleware uses an account-level DELETE request,
albeit with a query parameter of bulk-delete. But, one typo and,
assuming the cluster supports it and you have access, whoops, you
just marked the account for deletion!

I put a bit of extra safety on the account deletion by requiring it
to have an empty query string.

Change-Id: Ib5df11193b04eff69d14185bd9d0607169131e7f
'}]
commit_message:
Extra safety on account-level DELETE

I just noticed tonight when adding a bunch of stuff to Swiftly that
the Bulk Delete middleware uses an account-level DELETE request,
albeit with a query parameter of bulk-delete. But, one typo and,
assuming the cluster supports it and you have access, whoops, you
just marked the account for deletion!

I put a bit of extra safety on the account deletion by requiring it
to have an empty query string.

Change-Id: Ib5df11193b04eff69d14185bd9d0607169131e7f

commit_message:
Allows VMs to start up properly after host reboot

When a host starts up, it'll check if instances were running before the reboot,
by looking in the DB. If the instance was, it'll power that instance up.

 + Re-adds the 'start_guests_on_host_boot' config option
 + Makes it respect the DB status
 + Updates the nova.conf sample

Flags: DocImpact
Fixes bug 1169769

Change-Id: I9a8ae76757c32213612e132c223f1466234f1247

[{'created': '2013-04-19 04:50:03.000000000', 'message': 'Extra safety on account-level DELETE

I just noticed tonight when adding a bunch of stuff to Swiftly that
the Bulk Delete middleware uses an account-level DELETE request,
albeit with a query parameter of bulk-delete. But, one typo and,
assuming the cluster supports it and you have access, whoops, you
just marked the account for deletion!

I put a bit of extra safety on the account deletion by requiring it
to have an empty query string.

Change-Id: I1693109cb5383f9611736fdd479ece48ece04f13
'}]
commit_message:
Extra safety on account-level DELETE

I just noticed tonight when adding a bunch of stuff to Swiftly that
the Bulk Delete middleware uses an account-level DELETE request,
albeit with a query parameter of bulk-delete. But, one typo and,
assuming the cluster supports it and you have access, whoops, you
just marked the account for deletion!

I put a bit of extra safety on the account deletion by requiring it
to have an empty query string.

Change-Id: I1693109cb5383f9611736fdd479ece48ece04f13

I'd expect to see additions to the test suite for this kind of change, probably to the nova/tests/network/test_quantumv2.py file"}, {'account_id': 7021, 'date': '2013-04-08 13:11:58.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-04-08 13:55:23.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Doesn't seem to work

Build failed.  For information on how to proceed, see https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GerritJenkinsGithub#Test_Failures

"}, {'account_id': 1779, 'date': '2013-04-08 14:06:30.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Still no tests"}, {'account_id': 2835, 'date': '2013-04-08 14:13:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Can you describe the use case for this, please?  (And yes, needs unit tests.)"}, {'account_id': 191, 'date': '2013-04-08 15:59:34.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

please no"}, {'account_id': 3217, 'date': '2013-04-08 19:22:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

I'm not going to approve this without tests either, but I certainly want and need this for accurately representing physical networks using Nova and Quantum.

I can do this for physical networks, and I would like to be able to replicate those physical networks as virtual networks.  For instance, if I want to accurately represent active/backup link redundancy when testing installations, it's necessary to be able to link two NICs on the same VM to the same network.

It's also necessary when you have an appliance VM (i.e. one that is sealed, that you can't modify the internals of) that comes with control and server interfaces and you wish to attach both interfaces to the same network.  A 3rd party load balancer might be configured that way for use as LB-on-a-stack, for instance.

Trey, can you perhaps explain what it is you don't like?"}, {'account_id': 385, 'date': '2013-04-10 18:44:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Re the 1:1 mapping of physical->virtual, Nova is a cloud system not a virtual datacenter. The point of cloud is to abstract out the physical world into building blocks, so to get "ha" style for some vm's you don't setup ha on the vm's themselves, you do so on the hyperwiser level, and the vm's are agnostic to it.

The appliance case is a straw man argument. If the appliance requires two different networks for dataplane and controlplane, then there is probably good reason for that. Allowing nova to mux the two synthetically would then be a "unsupported configuration" since even though the vm sees two nics, there is only one network backing it. I would highly doubt any appliance provider would support this configuration.'}, {'account_id': 3217, 'date': '2013-04-10 19:06:40.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Firstly, can we take this to the bug, since the arguments here are largely 'this is not a bug'.

Secondly, the arguments here also fall into the category of 'we shouldn't implement this because you don't need to do this'.  Firstly I *do* need to do this (or, perhaps, a better way of putting this is I *want* do this within Openstack and it's going to be a complete PITA if I can't), and secondly arguments against doing this should be of the form 'it is so incredibly complex to do this that the risks outweigh the benefits' - is that really the case given that there's 50 lines of code required to make it happen?"}, {'account_id': 642, 'date': '2013-04-10 20:25:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

I'm chiming in here partially to point out that "This is easy, so why not?" is never a good reason to do something, and often leads to a code base that's difficult to maintain. So asking others to frame their arguments as such isn't constructive. 

With that said, I agree with the gist of Jason's argument: Nova shouldn't be responsible for this. Going forward, the interaction with Quantum will become more and more authoritative for how networking should be represented for a given device, both including and excluding Nova. Shortly, we should expect to see Nova go from "I need these specific networks" to "Hey quantum, I need networking." I feel this change is incompatible with that direction.

Finally, this definitely *is* a feature, not a bug. I'd file a blueprint. If you're planning to attend the summit, this would be the exact kind of thing to discuss there.'}, {'account_id': 3217, 'date': '2013-04-10 21:07:50.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

I actually asked others to frame their arguments as a cost/benefit analysis.  Not 'let us do this because it's a simple thing to do' but 'I want this for the use cases listed and the change is small and low risk, so I would ask that there is a strong argument not to do it before we decide against.'

It is a feature only in the sense that it has never worked.  The reason it's never worked is because the datastructure Hareesh has changed was incapable of storing more than one port per network.  Quantum has absolutely no problem with multiple ports on one network.  The only reason it doesn't work is because of this code here."}, {'account_id': 385, 'date': '2013-04-10 22:05:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

I'm not sure I'm understanding the argument in favor at all then. 

> and secondly arguments against doing this should be of the form 'it
> is so incredibly complex to do this that the risks outweigh the 
> benefits' - is that really the case given that there's 50 lines of
> code required to make it happen?

This really sounds like the argument in favor is "its simple so why not". Please help me understand how its not.

> It is a feature only in the sense that it has never worked.

Was it ever supposed to work like this? I can't find any reference to this support existing. This is a change to the behavior of the system to support a desire or in other words a feature.

It is also depends on the hyperwisor virt support. I would be interested if anyone used this patch to spin up an instance with multiple vifs successfully. Libvirt still uses the legacy format which relies on the template generation which in turn will try to create bridges multiple times one for each vif (if my memory of the libvirt code serves me correctly). On Xapi mileage may vary as it is reliant on the vif driver being used and its configuration.

Code wise in this patch lets figure out a way to do it without a double loop (hidden in the call to the function that is only ever used once). But I'm still -1 on the feature in general because a use case that is not better solved with a proper quantum configuration has not been presented (data and control plane muxing).'}, {'account_id': 7021, 'date': '2013-04-11 15:40:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Good discussion. I had filed this patch as a bug under the belief that this was a functionality that could have provided by nova, but being not needed in most situations, was not there for the sake of simplicity.

But from this discussion it seems that is not the case and there is a disparity of views too. Hence a new patch set with unit tests (that I have been working on) may be not ideal at this stage. 

I am coming to the summit next week and would like have a discussion around this to see what is the best way to proceed. I can provide more details on the use case side too. 

Can any of the reviewers suggest a good session/time to synch up and discuss this?

Thanks.'}, {'account_id': 7021, 'date': '2013-04-11 15:45:50.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

@Jason: 
>I would be interested if anyone used this patch to spin up an instance with multiple vifs successfully.

Yes,it did work (libvirt+KVM). But you have a good point and I would check it a bit more to see I didn't miss something. Thanks."}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-04-19 06:03:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-04-19 06:03:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Abandoned

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}]
